question: How to perform chin tucks to treat neck pain?
answer: for the top three exercises for neck.pain and posture exercise number one is.the chin tuck and what you want to do.for this is grab a rolled towel place it.behind the smaller the arch of your neck.laying flat on your back you can bend.your knees for comfort to protect your.lower back if you like what youre going.to do is tuck your chin straight back.into the towel so go ahead okay this is.a pretty small movement but its.important for strengthening the muscles.in the neck that control not only your.the bones in your neck your neck.vertebrae go ahead 10 second hold and.then relax it should feel pretty.relaxing for people who have headaches.that start right here call a sub.occipital headache starts right here.travels up and over can be on one side.this is a great exercise for them the.thing that commonly happens is with bad.posture and it falls forward we want to.strengthen these muscles to bring the.chin and the head back into the position.that theyre supposed to be this its.called chin tuck 10 second hold and
subtitles: for the top three exercises for neck.pain and posture exercise number one is.the chin tuck and what you want to do.for this is grab a rolled towel place it.behind the smaller the arch of your neck.laying flat on your back you can bend.your knees for comfort to protect your.lower back if you like what you're going.to do is tuck your chin straight back.into the towel so go ahead okay this is.a pretty small movement but it's.important for strengthening the muscles.in the neck that control not only your.the bones in your neck your neck.vertebrae go ahead 10 second hold and.then relax it should feel pretty.relaxing for people who have headaches.that start right here call a sub.occipital headache starts right here.travels up and over can be on one side.this is a great exercise for them the.thing that commonly happens is with bad.posture and it falls forward we want to.strengthen these muscles to bring the.chin and the head back into the position.that they're supposed to be this it's.called chin tuck 10 second hold and.second exercise is scapular retraction.what that really means is squeezing your.shoulder blades down and back most.people when they poor posture their.shoulders fall forward and their head.Falls forward we want to work on.bringing your shoulder blades together.and back so what we're going to do and.you can do this at your desk or anywhere.in the home as well.sit up nice and straight eyes level eyes.forward chin up squeeze your shoulder.blades together and back right the thing.that we commonly see is people shrug.their shoulders up as they're as they're.squeezing your shoulder blades together.and back they'll squeeze them up at the.same time you want to avoid doing that.you want.keep your your shoulders down away from.your ears down and back okay in the.clinic we hold five seconds do it 10.times if you're feeling brave you can do.it up to 20 times third exercise for top.three exercises for neck pain and.posture is a corner stretch and once.again what commonly happens is head.Falls forward shoulders fall forward all.the muscles in the chest and and in your.front they become tight so we want to.open that up and make it easier for the.shoulders to fall back into their good.posture position so we do is a find a.corner that's open keep your eyes level.and you're just going to lean in lightly.a little more advanced version is to.keep your elbows up at shoulder level.forearms perpendicular to the ground.up at 90 degree angle lean in should.feel a gentle stretch across the the.upper chest I'm going to hold that 30.seconds and in the clinic we do three of.those so top three exercises for neck.pain and posture

question: How to perform scapular retractions to treat neck pain?
answer: called chin tuck 10 second hold and.second exercise is scapular retraction.what that really means is squeezing your.shoulder blades down and back most.people when they poor posture their.shoulders fall forward and their head.Falls forward we want to work on.bringing your shoulder blades together.and back so what were going to do and.you can do this at your desk or anywhere.in the home as well.sit up nice and straight eyes level eyes.forward chin up squeeze your shoulder.blades together and back right the thing.that we commonly see is people shrug.their shoulders up as theyre as theyre.squeezing your shoulder blades together.and back theyll squeeze them up at the.same time you want to avoid doing that.you want.keep your your shoulders down away from.your ears down and back okay in the.clinic we hold five seconds do it 10.times if youre feeling brave you can do.it up to 20 times third exercise for top

question: How to perform corner stretches to treat neck pain?
answer: times if youre feeling brave you can do.it up to 20 times third exercise for top.three exercises for neck pain and.posture is a corner stretch and once.again what commonly happens is head.Falls forward shoulders fall forward all.the muscles in the chest and and in your.front they become tight so we want to.open that up and make it easier for the.shoulders to fall back into their good.posture position so we do is a find a.corner thats open keep your eyes level.and youre just going to lean in lightly.a little more advanced version is to.keep your elbows up at shoulder level.forearms perpendicular to the ground.up at 90 degree angle lean in should.feel a gentle stretch across the the.upper chest Im going to hold that 30.seconds and in the clinic we do three of.those so top three exercises for neck

question: How do you put on a clavicle brace?
answer: and remove this brace This will help prevent you from further injuring.yourself especially if youre recovering for a broken clavicle Begin by unfolding.the brace and laying it flat to identify the left and right straps Undo the.Velcro closures on the ends of the straps Have the person helping you.position the felt back pad behind your shoulder blades with the plastic.triangle pointing down Have them carefully wrap the left strap over your.left shoulder and under your armpit They should feed the end of the left strap.through the left side of the plastic triangle buckle and attach the Velcro closure.Repeat this process with the right strap The brace should now be in a.figure 8 shape To adjust the fit the person helping should pull the straps.tighter or loosen the straps until your desired level of clavicle or posture.support is reached Make sure they adjust one strap at a time to prevent further injury.Once on and properly adjusted you should.feel your shoulders being gently pulled back If you experience any pain or.discomfort have the straps loosened If you would like to see more information
subtitles: The clavicle is one of the most commonly broken bones, especially among people who.play high impact sports This brace keeps your collarbone area immobilized after a.simple break or fracture so your bone can heal The figure-8 design wraps.around both of your shoulders, which helps hold your shoulders back, keeping.your clavicle stable, while also improving your posture The small has.2" wide straps and the medium through extra-large have 3" wide straps.These straps are thicker to properly stabilize your collarbone Because it's.only adjustable in the back, you will need someone to help you apply, adjust,.and remove this brace This will help prevent you from further injuring.yourself, especially if you're recovering for a broken clavicle Begin by unfolding.the brace and laying it flat to identify the left and right straps Undo the.Velcro closures on the ends of the straps Have the person helping you.position the felt back pad behind your shoulder blades with the plastic.triangle pointing down Have them carefully wrap the left strap over your.left shoulder and under your armpit They should feed the end of the left strap.through the left side of the plastic triangle buckle and attach the Velcro closure.Repeat this process with the right strap The brace should now be in a."figure 8" shape To adjust the fit, the person helping should pull the straps.tighter, or loosen the straps until your desired level of clavicle or posture.support is reached Make sure they adjust one strap at a time to prevent further injury.Once on and properly adjusted, you should.feel your shoulders being gently pulled back If you experience any pain or.discomfort, have the straps loosened If you would like to see more information.about a similar brace, specifically designed to improve your posture, click here.And if you found this brace helpful and would like to see more similar.videos in the future, subscribe to our channel!

area immobilized after a', '(9.48, 14.4)': 'simple break or fracture so your bone can heal The figure-8 design wraps', '(14.4, 17.97)': 'around both of your shoulders, which helps hold your shoulders back, keeping', '(17.97, 23.22)': 'your clavicle stable, while also improving your posture The small has', '(23.22, 27.15)': '2" wide straps and the medium through extra-large have 3" wide straps', '(27.15, 32.219)': "These straps are thicker to properly stabilize your collarbone Because it's", '(32.219, 36.120000000000005)': 'only adjustable in the back, you will need someone to help you apply, adjust,', '(36.12, 40.29)': 'and remove this brace This will help prevent you from further injuring', '(40.29, 45.149)': "yourself, especially if you're recovering for a broken clavicle Begin by unfolding", '(45.149, 51.0)': 'the brace and laying it flat to identify the left and right straps Undo the', '(51.0, 55.559)': 'Velcro closures on the ends of the straps Have the person helping you', '(55.559, 59.459999999999994)': 'position the felt back pad behind your shoulder blades with the plastic', '(59.46, 64.43900000000001)': 'triangle pointing down Have them carefully wrap the left strap over your', '(64.439, 69.21)': 'left shoulder and under your armpit They should feed the end of the left strap', '(69.21, 73.04899999999999)': 'through the left side of the plastic triangle buckle and attach the Velcro closure', '(73.049, 79.11000000000001)': 'Repeat this process with the right strap The brace should now be in a', '(79.11, 84.33)': '"figure 8" shape To adjust the fit, the person helping should pull the straps', '(84.33, 89.03999999999999)': 'tighter, or loosen the straps until your desired level of clavicle or posture', '(89.04, 93.659)': 'support is reached Make sure they adjust one strap at a time to prevent further injury', '(93.659, 97.38000000000001)': 'Once on and properly adjusted, you should', '(97.38, 101.939)': 'feel your shoulders being gently pulled back If you experience any pain or', '(101.939, 106.86)': 'discomfort, have the straps loosened If you would like to see more information', '(106.86, 111.09)': 'about a similar brace, specifically designed to improve your posture, click here', '(111.09, 114.509)': 'And if you found this brace helpful and would like to see more similar', '(114.509, 120.14)': 'videos in the future, subscribe to our channel!'}

question: How to assess the supraclavicular lymph nodes
answer: assessing the supraclavicular lymph.nodes they are as the name would suggest.above the clavicle situated in the super.Kovac Euler fossa and all felt with both.sides feeling deeply inside the fossa.and the lymph nodes have been.exaggerated and can be seen here the
subtitles: the lymph node examination is part of.the general examination and as with any.procedure on a patient you must make.sure you wash your hands.introduce yourself to the patient and.take adequate consent this is.particularly important with an.examination the lymph nodes as the.majority the examination is done from.behind the patient therefore it is vital.the patient knows what you're about to.do and where you wish placing your hands.to begin with let's examine where the.lymph nodes are positioned in terms of.assessing the supraclavicular lymph.nodes they are as the name would suggest.above the clavicle situated in the super.Kovac Euler fossa and all felt with both.sides feeling deeply inside the fossa.and the lymph nodes have been.exaggerated and can be seen here the.submental lymph nodes are examined with.direct pressure underneath the chin as.is seen here as with all parts of the.lymph node examination both hands are.used your feeling for a series of.features on any potential masses or.nodes found the submental lymph nodes.previously examined and now identified.here in red or separate from the.submandibular lymph nodes which run.along the lengths of the jaw and are.again examined carefully with the.fingers bilaterally the cervical lymph.nodes are located in a Z shape pattern.on the side of the neck they are deep to.the sternocleidomastoid muscles and.shallow to the scalene muscles.and are examined with the flaps of the.fingers in this similar Z shape the pre.Oracle lymph nodes are located just.anterior to the tragus of the ear and.are examined whereas the post or ocular.lymph nodes are actually located behind.the Pinner and are examined so the final.set of lymph nodes on the scale are the.occipital lymph nodes and are located at.the top of the neutral line where.trapezius joins into the skull

question: How to avoid snoring?

subtitles: Bob and Brad   The two most famous   Physical therapists on the internet  All right.(clapping loudly).Hi folks, I'm Bob Schrupp, Physical Therapist.Brad Heineck Physical Therapist.Together we are the most famous.physical therapists on the internet.In our opinion of course Bob.Turn my mic on now so you can hear me.Today, we're gonna talk about.how to sleep all night without being awakened.from snoring or dry mouth.Those are two different issues.We're gonna go over them separately.We're also gonna talk about some home remedies.Right, absolutely Bob.If one of you or your family members.or someone in the house.has got problems with snoring or dry mouth,.and both my wife and I have dealt with this.I don't know if it's the aging process or what,.but it's an issue in our house and we've came up,.you know, I wanna share what we've learned,.but I know we're not the only ones.Well this is where our audience.is gonna start to benefit from us getting older.'Cause as we get things,.we're gonna do videos on 'em or as our family members.So, we're gonna be doin' lots of things on as we age.And it's because we care Bob.Yeah, we care.So by the way, if you're new to our channel,.please take a second to subscribe to us.We provide videos, how to stay healthy,.live pain free for you.We upload every day.Also go to bobandbradcom and go to the giveaway section,.'cause we're always giving something away,.every week we're having a contest.What, what're we doin'?.This week we're giving away the wall anchor.So this is a anchor you attach to your wall.and you can easily attach resistance bands to 'em-.You have to stretch it- You can workout with them.You don't have to anchor on a bolt?.No, not anchor on a bolt or an anchor around your neck.So, you can go to Facebook, the contest.Also, we pinned it to the top of the page,.our Facebook page.Go to Twitter or Instagram or TikTok.if you want a 60 second version of our program.All right Brad.Well, first of all, I think what we wanna do,.or what I decided to do is,.'cause it's our show and it's my choice on this one.I tackle snoring.Snoring first.Right, I mean-.Big problem for a lot of people.Exactly right, if you don't snore someone in your house,.and either way, it can affect the whole household.Right, right.Like I was telling you earlier,.my you know, when my daughter was,.you know, before she left the house,.actually, you know, she didn't just leave,.anyways- She went to the college.We kept her awake many nights from our snoring,.not just me, but my wife as well.And so that's a problem.So, why do you snore?.It happens because when you fall asleep.the muscles in your throat, they relax.and with open mouth breathing.it starts to get these vibrations.And you know, it can be like my dad,.we always joked it's a chainsaw, you know?.Right.How many cords of wood did you cut last night Dad?.Yeah, I had a friend that stayed at our cabin,.it was unreal, it was a phenomenon, I mean.Did you hand out earplugs?.Oh, I mean I had doors shut.and you could hear him, I mean.(giggling).I mean, I think the town was complaining.Yeah, we don't wanna talk about it.that'll make the news.What seriously, you can get this looked at by a doctor.I think you should.You can talk to them.One thing they might do,.this is we're not doin' this video.to promote this necessarily,.'cause you probably don't need it,.but sometimes a sleep study.You'll go in and yes you sleep.and they hook you up and look at your heart rate.and monitor you as you sleep.Well, I wanted to say this Brad,.it often is a sign of sleep apnea.and sleep apnea is not to be taken lightly.I mean, it could lead to a lot of medical issues.Right, I've heard people say,.I'm not willing to accept this personally yet,.but you know, if I ever need one,.because I don't wanna be hooked up to a thing,.but I know many people say,.once they got a C-PAP they realized-.How much sleep they were missing out on.Well, they wake up in the morning.with so much more energy,.'cause they weren't oxygen deprived.that slight amount for eight hours.So, that's one possible thing.Oral devices, they make custom ones.that you can put in your mouth that help.Appliances that are custom made for your mouth right?.Exactly.Or you know, worst case scenario, surgery.But we're lookin' at you feel pretty confident.You're a healthy person, but you got this snoring thing.You know, maybe you could just try something simple.that the worst it's gonna do is not help.Help the snoring.You know, one of the harder things,.you know, if you happened to be a heavier person,.if you lose some weight that can reduce.some of the soft tissue.Yeah, we're talkin' about the ones.that are gonna be very difficult to do.Yeah, that ones not a-.We know everybody wants to lose weight-.Right, stop smoking!.That's a tough one.Another tough one.Y'all know it.And but a lot of you aren't able to do it.It's like a monkey on your back quite often.Don't worry, we're saving the easy one for last.So just hang in there folks.Allergies, if you're dealing with allergies,.if you can get a medication that eliminates that.That's an easier one.Yeah, that is, but this is the one,.because my wife and I decided to go all the way.to the very easiest one.A good friend of mine was having problems with this.while he was goin' through a cancer treatment.and his dry mouth was-.Well, we're talkin' about snoring first.Snoring, I'm getting to that, yeah.But, tape your mouth and you know where he learned it from?.And I found out, this is where you're gonna find.a lot of these tricks is not from a medical doctor,.but from a dentist.'Cause the dentist, this is his area of study.Actually, the oral cavity in the world.Hey, that's all they do.So, you didn't mention.sleeping on your side though Brad.Oh, thank you for reminding me Bob.You can try sleeping on your side.They also have those nasal strips.You said your wife tried those?.Exactly, she put those little things,.that they're kind of spring loaded,.you tape 'em down and they're not that expensive.And then they change and we don't know.for sure- That it helped?.Well, what happened was she put those on.as well as taping her mouth.Could she breathe?.Yes, yes, I'm gonna show you in just a little bit here,.but yeah, I slept like a baby,.she was quiet all night long.I had to wake up a couple of times.to make sure she was alive.Well, you'd wonder.You taped her nose shut and you taped her mouth shut,.yeah, I would wonder if she's alive too.Seriously for the tape,.you can just use a little baby.one of those little skinny band-aids.For you on the podcast,.all he has just a little thin piece of tape.It's about a quarter inch wide.and maybe an inch long.and I'm doing this so you can see it.Actually, she used scotch tape.[Bob] Did she really Yeah, I've done that too.I mean, I've done this too 'cause I'm guilty of snoring.You may wanna get some tape.that's for the, you know, for the skin.that is hypersensitive, you know?.'Cause you could start to break the skin down-.Right, see.'Cause I could talk with this.and I can breathe through here.So, it doesn't choke you and there's a skinny little tape,.because if something happens where you wanna open it,.you know- It breaks right open.It breaks up very easily.So, ouch!.(laughing).That point when we woke up,.we didn't know where my wife's tape was,."did you swallow it?".Ah, Geez.It was okay, we found it.So, anyways, yeah, there you go.Give it a try.Now, do you sleep on your side.or do you sleep on your back a lot?.A little bit of both.You know, I can't sleep on my side very long.because my back starts to be uncomfortable.Then I go back to my back.But yeah, I'm definitely snoring,.but I have a dry mouth issue.Sure, that's the second part,.part two of this video and podcast-.Of the saga that's goin' on at our house.as well as other houses-.Brad's world.Yeah, so the thing about dry mouth.is the medical term is xerostomia.Xerostomia, I know stomia means opening.Yeah, and I didn't look up Xero.it's probably a Latin word.And it's one of those words that's tricky,.because it starts with a X, but it sounds like a Z.That kind of thing bothers me.So, if your a English major out there.and you know why they do that,.I want a comment or two explaining that.So, xerostomia, dry mouth that causes of it.Now this is different than snoring.This is something I really think.you should talk to your doctor about.to clarify any problems.If you're a diabetic,.it may be a problem associated with it.If you had a stroke,.which you would probably know, that could be it.Or medication- Yeah, we see that a lot.I mean- Your medications.can cause dry mouth.Sometimes we have a saliva gland that has a problem.You want to get that checked out.So and again, dentist is probably the better source.than a medical doctor.Unless you got the medications from the medical doctor.Right, it's a good one to bring up with the doctor,.either one and see what they think.Right, if you're a healthy person you're not taking meds,.in my case, you know, that's the way I feel.As far as I know, I'm healthy and I keep track of myself,.I sleep with my mouth open and that's why I snore.But then it's dry in the house,.we don't have a dehumidifier going right now.Actually we have a-.You want humidifier?.Humidifier, right.So, I've got this dry air goin' in and out of my mouth.and you ever wake up and my mouth feels like sandpaper.Everything in there.It's like, the first time it happened,.I felt like, I was afraid, I thought,.I had to learn to talk again.So we went to the you know-.What a tragedy that would be.(giggling).Well, I went and I got some water.and it started to saturate like a sponge.It went back like normal, I felt pretty good.But anyways, it is a little scary.if you've never had it happen,.it's just dry as can be.Interesting Yeah.So anyways, put water by your bed,.the first little home remedy.So, you just wake up, drink some water and go back to bed.A humidifier in your bedroom.can be a nice way to help so it doesn't dry up.like the Sahara desert.And then of course no alcohol or caffeine.within a few hours before you go to bed.Right and we also forgot to mention.that's actually for snoring too.Alcohol can all enhance that.So we had to move our happy hour,.you know, from six o'clock until three o'clock.to eliminate that that possibility.(giggling).It's five o'clock somewhere.And then again, the same thing and this actually.He tried to tape this too.I gotta admit that I think it works better for snoring,.'cause you still, I'll have problems.when breathing in this way.So I get it, not near as bad,.but there's still a little dry mouth issues with this,.but you know, again, it's worth a try.It may do very well for a lot of people-.So the obvious joke is Brad, your wife requested.that you wear the tape all day long.and maybe a bigger piece.I mean, I'm sure that's come across her mind.That's pretty funny, yeah, you go to bed, get the tape.Yeah, get the tape.(giggling).It's time to get the tape in place.Yeah, it makes life in the bedroom amazing, so anyways.Stuff that you have to do when you get older,.I'll tell ya-.Sleep well, quietly and enjoy a nice-.And remember Brad and I can fix just about anything-.Oh yeah, except for-.We fixed snoring and everything else,.but we can't fix a broken heart.There you go, good luck with this.We made a little humor out of it, but that's life

question: How to use an incentive spirometer to maintain respiratory fitness?
answer: Saras going to exhale naturally and place the device in her mouth and inhale taking.a nice big deep breath in When youre inhaling you want to make sure that this flow cup is.maintained in the best flow range The white piston moves up very slowly Then do a nice.breath hold for five seconds and exhale.After your final breath hold we encourage you to cough to clear any secretions that.you may have We look forward to being a part of your successful recovery here at The Nebraska
subtitles: Hi, I Sandy and this is Sara Wee respiratory therapists here at The Nebraska.Medical Center We are here to demonstrate the use of the incentive Spirometer When.used according to your physician instructions, this device will help you maintain and improve.respiratory fitness Normally we take many deep breaths each hour, usually without being.aware of it They are spontaneous and automatic When you are experiencing pain after chest.or abdominal surgery, for example, breathing tends to become shallow And deep breaths.are suppressed in an effort to minimize pain In these instances, it important that.you try to resume your normal breathing pattern, despite any discomfort you may feel Taking.deep breaths will help prevent the possibility of respiratory complications.Sara going to exhale naturally and place the device in her mouth and inhale, taking.a nice big deep breath in When youe inhaling, you want to make sure that this flow cup is.maintained in the best flow range The white piston moves up very slowly Then do a nice.breath hold for five seconds and exhale.After your final breath hold, we encourage you to cough to clear any secretions that.you may have We look forward to being a part of your successful recovery here at The Nebraska.Medical Center
subtitle_timestamps: {'(6.919, 10.75)': 'Hi, I Sandy and this is Sara Wee respiratory therapists here at The Nebraska', '(10.75, 15.32)': 'Medical Center We are here to demonstrate the use of the incentive Spirometer When', '(15.32, 19.93)': 'used according to your physician instructions, this device will help you maintain and improve', '(19.93, 25.74)': 'respiratory fitness Normally we take many deep breaths each hour, usually without being', '(25.74, 31.419999999999998)': 'aware of it They are spontaneous and automatic When you are experiencing pain after chest', '(31.42, 36.82)': 'or abdominal surgery, for example, breathing tends to become shallow And deep breaths', '(36.82, 42.129)': 'are suppressed in an effort to minimize pain In these instances, it important that', '(42.129, 47.69)': 'you try to resume your normal breathing pattern, despite any discomfort you may feel Taking', '(47.69, 51.66)': 'deep breaths will help prevent the possibility of respiratory complications', '(51.66, 57.678999999999995)': 'Sara going to exhale naturally and place the device in her mouth and inhale, taking', '(57.679, 62.699)': 'a nice big deep breath in When youe inhaling, you want to make sure that this flow cup is', '(62.699, 68.90899999999999)': 'maintained in the best flow range The white piston moves up very slowly Then do a nice', '(68.909, 71.68)': 'breath hold for five seconds and exhale', '(71.68, 76.21000000000001)': 'After your final breath hold, we encourage you to cough to clear any secretions that', '(76.21, 81.00999999999999)': 'you may have We look forward to being a part of your successful recovery here at The Nebraska', '(81.01, 81.649)': 'Medical Center'}

and just.lifting up squeezing my shoulder blades.together so I'm working my middle and.lower traps and I'm coming down slowly.and I'm releasing okay one more time.squeezing shoulder blades together.pulling away from the ears and lifting.up not very high is it just a little bit.off the ground coming back down slowly.and releasing and coming back up so you.can see that's starting to strengthen.through the middle of the back now I do.have an exercise video on stretching out.the top muscles that will give you some.temporary relief you might like to see.that list in the link below but.otherwise start on a combination of.stretching out those top muscles and.strengthening through the middle and the.lower back I really hope today's video.helps you start to strengthen and switch.off these top muscles and I'll see you.next time thanks for watching.[Music]

question: How to identify if you may have a pinched nerve?
answer: Sure. So first lets talk about the symptoms.What are the things youre gonna feel when.you have a pinched nerve.One thing you might have quite often is pain.cause youre getting compression.on a nerve is what is is happening.And the nerves are coming out.from your spinal cord and going.from the spinal cord into your arms.and into your legs. And in this area they wrap around the trunk. Sure They wrap around the trunk.so you can get actually pain.or a compression of a nerve anywhere.in the body in essence. Right. So lets start talking.about some of the common symptoms youre gonna feel.First off you can have pain.you can have radiating pain pain.thats going down. Right. The extremity you can have. Numbness burning tingling.A lot of times people in the clinic.I know that when they got it in their low back.and its going down their leg I just.had a woman yesterday.It feels real tight a pulling sensation. Right. Its hard to describe a nerve pain compared.to like a pain where youre you know.if you break your arm.or a mechanical pain is very clear.where nerve pain is also. It can be ever changing too. Yep exactly weird. Quite often when people start getting.and thats a good way to put it.A lot of times when people come in.theyre having really strange symptoms.I often go you know what.That sounds like nerve pain cause nerve pain.It just gives you really weird things.You can get like hot and cold sensations. Sure Yeah exactly. Pins and needles.If you start getting weakness in the arm.thats often quite often can be. Thats getting more serious. Thats getting more serious spasms.that can be from from nerve compression too. And and one thing I wanna point out.as a therapist or a physician.or a chiropractor we pay attention.to where that you feel the pain you know.is it on the front of your arm.or the back of the arm inside of the leg.outside of the leg because that tells us possibly.which nerve is actually being pinched.We know its all mapped out where L three.the nerve coming out of L three and your Lumbar spine.where that goes down in your leg you know what.L five goes down the top of your foot.if you feel symptoms there. Right.So where youre having the pain.it could be where youre having the pinch nerve.but quite often it isnt. Right. And its a real its a real treasure hunt here.Kind of trying to figure out investigative job.trying to figure out where.the problem is coming from

question: How to identify if you may have honeymoon palsy?
answer: You dont even know what that would be.But another one would be.honeymoon P honeymoon palsy.You fall asleep and your honeys.on your arm like this. Yeah This looks like your honey. Yeah This is my honey.And all night long youre afraid.to get away from her.And theres a joke too about nodding off.That also causes a palsy in your arm
subtitles: Hi, I'm Bob Schrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck physical therapist.And together we are the most famous physical.therapists on the internet.In our opinion of course.Think fast Today we're gonna talk.about what is a pinch nerve.A lot of people get a pinch nerve.or they get a pain.And they say they've been diagnosed.and they say, well somewhere you.have a pinch nerve.We're gonna kind of go talk.about where you can pinch a nerve.and what it is and, and what,.what symptoms it gives you.Sure.So first let's talk about the symptoms.What are the things you're gonna feel when.you have a pinched nerve?.One thing you might have quite often is pain.'cause you're getting compression.on a nerve is what is is happening.And the nerves are coming out.from your spinal cord and going.from the spinal cord into your arms.and into your legs.And in this area, they wrap around the trunk.Sure They wrap around the trunk.so you can get actually pain.or a compression of a nerve anywhere.in the body in essence.Right.So let's start talking.about some of the common symptoms you're gonna feel.First off, you can have pain.you can have radiating pain, pain,.that's going down.Right?.The extremity, you can have-.Numbness, burning, tingling.A lot of times, people in the clinic.I know that when they got it in their low back.and it's going down their leg, I just.had a woman yesterday.It feels real tight, a pulling sensation.Right.It's hard to describe a nerve pain compared.to like a pain where you're, you know,.if you break your arm.or a mechanical pain is very clear.where nerve pain is also.It can be ever changing too.Yep, exactly weird.Quite often when people start getting.and that's a good way to put it.A lot of times when people come in.they're having really strange symptoms.I often go, you know what?.That sounds like nerve pain, 'cause nerve pain.It just gives you really weird things.You can get like hot and cold sensations.Sure Yeah, exactly.Pins and needles.If you start getting weakness in the arm,.that's often quite often can be-.That's getting more serious.That's getting more serious spasms.that can be from from nerve compression too.And, and one thing I wanna point out.as a therapist or a physician.or a chiropractor, we pay attention.to where that you feel the pain, you know,.is it on the front of your arm.or the back of the arm, inside of the leg.outside of the leg, because that tells us possibly.which nerve is actually being pinched.We know it's all mapped out where L three.the nerve coming out of L three and your Lumbar spine.where that goes down in your leg, you know what?.L five goes down the top of your foot.if you feel symptoms there.Right.So where you're having the pain.it could be where you're having the pinch nerve.but quite often it isn't.Right.And it's a real, it's a real treasure hunt here.Kind of trying to figure out investigative job.trying to figure out where.the problem is coming from.So let's talk about a couple, some.of the common areas where you might.have a pinch nerve.Nancy, could we have the spine right away?.Who's catching.There ya go.Okay We got our spine here.Spine.This is really where a partial head here.These are the bones that stack.up to make your back, you know,.within the bones itself there's a canal.and that's your spinal cord.And coming off the spinal cord are these nerves.All right these are the nerves.that can get compressed or pinched.Right.All right One of the common areas.that can get pinched is right.when it's coming outta these holes here,.the right right in that spot here,.as you get older you want to zoom in.and Brad, can you kind of point out?.Sure Yep.Okay So now the nerves remember.are not a half inch long like I'm here.They, they actually, the nerves.are go down into your arm the nerves.and this area will wrap around your chest.and the ones out here go down to your legs.But here's that whole valve talking.about where the nerve exits.from the spinal cord directly connected.to the spinal cord.As you get older there,.your neck will become arthritic.Sure.I can tell you from age 20 on it's deteriorating.these holes start to get smaller just.from arthritic changes.Right.And so there's less room.for the nerve to get out.If let's say the nerve gets a little bit.swollen suddenly there's, there's no room.for it to come out and it's getting pinched right.Where as it comes out.Sure.Less common in the lumbar area.cause these holes are quite bigger.but what can happen in the lumbar area?.Brad, bigger, the holes there are larger,.Larger.Okay The holes there are larger.Okay.And so there's a lot more room.for the nerves to come out.So it's unlikely that you're gonna get pinching.from the hole itself in the lumbar area.but you can get a disc problem.And here's a nice model.You talk about a slip disc.That's really not correct is a herniated disc.and a herniated disc, you can see here.Can you zoom in on this pretty good?.The bald dried here?.Why don't you show a healthy disc first, Brad.This is a healthy disc.Sure That's a good idea.A healthy disc is kept in here.Usually a little thicker in the front.a little narrower in the back and.It's all contained it.Exactly.Boy We know we've got another video.on some details on the disc without getting into.that the disc will actually bulge out.Put Pressure.Yeah.Put pressure on the, on a specific nerve.And that nerve will send symptoms wherever.that nerve tracks.And here they go down into the leg.And that the.the pain that you get often.from nerve pain is off quite often.Some of the worst pain you'll have.Yeah It is.Nerve pain is not fun.Exactly.I know when you can tell.when someone's drilling into a nerve.that, you know that's the way they'll.make you talk, If they wanna torture you.So the other thing that could be causing pressure.on a nerve is even scar tissue.Sure.If you a nerve, the nerve.can actually get scarred down.and when you move it,.it actually puts pressure on it.Cause increased pain.We've had sometimes I've had people that have.had scar tissue on a nerve in their back.And we actually had to stretch that nerve.Right.To break up that scar tissue.After a surgery sometimes you.can have scarred filled up or an injury.So the other thing is, as the nerves come out.anywhere along this path,.they can get pinched somewhere.Sure.And the common one that many of you probably.know about is carpal tunnel syndrome.and there's a band or ligament.that goes across here and the.the nerve crosses underneath that ligament.And especially if you do a lot.of repetitive activities like typing.or where you're bending your wrist this way.or this way or.Factory type work.Or factory type work that ligament.can thicken up and there's less room.for the nerve to go under.And that's where you can get pinched nerve also.So the job of the physician or doctor.or physical therapist is to figure out.where along this path for your arms,.are you getting a pinch nerve or where along.you know your legs, where from the back to the legs.are you getting a pinched nerve.Right.And which we usually call sciatica.Sure.The other thing we thought.we talked about a couple fun ones, right?.Brad, there's some names out there for.for nerves that get pinched.And these are the ones that are generally more.of a temporary pinch.but one is called Saturday night palsy.And this is apparently what happens.if you fall asleep like.on a bar or over the, over a chair like that.you get pressure on the back of your nerve, your.your arm there, that's a radial nerve palsy.and you wake up and you're so drunk.that you, you don't wake up at all.You wake up in your arms,.you can't move your arms.They're they're they're yeah.They, they, they cut off so much that the.the nerves cannot fire the muscles.It's I've never experienced that.You don't even know what that would be.But another one would be.honeymoon Phoneymoon palsy.You fall asleep and your honey's.on your arm like this.Yeah This looks like your honey.Yeah This is my honey.And all night long, you're afraid.to get away from her.And there's a joke too, about nodding off.That also causes a palsy in your arm.Another one is, could be related.as a handcuff neuropathy.I wouldn't about that either.That are too tight.they can actually put pressure on the nerves.And the last one we're gonna mention is,.is a crutch palsy.I wish we had some crutches here but.that's why when we, when you use crutches we try.to teach you that you're really not trying to.to hang on them or, or lean on to them onto them.It should not put pressure to your armpit,.Right.It should be going through your arm.You got a big plexus of nerves coming.through your armpit here and into the arm.And if you lean on those crutches.they're actually going to cause.the crutch pad is not made for padding.to put up-.The pressure should be on your.your palms.Right.And squeezing the, the crutches in.So that they're-.I got another one though Bob.I can show you this one,.Another palsy?.Yeah I don't know what you call it,.but she can't see me.Oh.If I go to sleep on my stomach.which I don't much anymore.Cause I bother with my back.But if I sleep like this.I've waken up and hours are completely.sleep completely I can't do anything.I've already done this.And I bit my hand, ah, like you.can't feel those thing.It's pretty fun.Oh, I actually, I woke up one time.and the alarm's going off in both arms like that.Yeah And I'm going like this, turn, the knock.turn the alarm off.That's kinda fun.The other one that is a common one that is.you're driving along.This is why you shouldn't wear your wallet.and your back pocket.Yeah.You're gonna -you're gonna actually.pressure on your CIC nerve.And I had it one time where my foot fell asleep.and I was hitting the brake.and I couldn't feel it.And I'm coming to a stop light and I.I can't stop the car because I'm pushing as well.All my might.So I stopped wearing my wallet in the back.Yeah.Back pocket there.That's that big thick wallet.Well, I just got papers in it.There there's nothing else in it.Believe me.All right

subtitles: Hi, I'm Bob Schrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck physical therapist.And together we are the most famous physical.therapists on the internet.In our opinion of course.Think fast Today we're gonna talk.about what is a pinch nerve.A lot of people get a pinch nerve.or they get a pain.And they say they've been diagnosed.and they say, well somewhere you.have a pinch nerve.We're gonna kind of go talk.about where you can pinch a nerve.and what it is and, and what,.what symptoms it gives you.Sure.So first let's talk about the symptoms.What are the things you're gonna feel when.you have a pinched nerve?.One thing you might have quite often is pain.'cause you're getting compression.on a nerve is what is is happening.And the nerves are coming out.from your spinal cord and going.from the spinal cord into your arms.and into your legs.And in this area, they wrap around the trunk.Sure They wrap around the trunk.so you can get actually pain.or a compression of a nerve anywhere.in the body in essence.Right.So let's start talking.about some of the common symptoms you're gonna feel.First off, you can have pain.you can have radiating pain, pain,.that's going down.Right?.The extremity, you can have-.Numbness, burning, tingling.A lot of times, people in the clinic.I know that when they got it in their low back.and it's going down their leg, I just.had a woman yesterday.It feels real tight, a pulling sensation.Right.It's hard to describe a nerve pain compared.to like a pain where you're, you know,.if you break your arm.or a mechanical pain is very clear.where nerve pain is also.It can be ever changing too.Yep, exactly weird.Quite often when people start getting.and that's a good way to put it.A lot of times when people come in.they're having really strange symptoms.I often go, you know what?.That sounds like nerve pain, 'cause nerve pain.It just gives you really weird things.You can get like hot and cold sensations.Sure Yeah, exactly.Pins and needles.If you start getting weakness in the arm,.that's often quite often can be-.That's getting more serious.That's getting more serious spasms.that can be from from nerve compression too.And, and one thing I wanna point out.as a therapist or a physician.or a chiropractor, we pay attention.to where that you feel the pain, you know,.is it on the front of your arm.or the back of the arm, inside of the leg.outside of the leg, because that tells us possibly.which nerve is actually being pinched.We know it's all mapped out where L three.the nerve coming out of L three and your Lumbar spine.where that goes down in your leg, you know what?.L five goes down the top of your foot.if you feel symptoms there.Right.So where you're having the pain.it could be where you're having the pinch nerve.but quite often it isn't.Right.And it's a real, it's a real treasure hunt here.Kind of trying to figure out investigative job.trying to figure out where.the problem is coming from.So let's talk about a couple, some.of the common areas where you might.have a pinch nerve.Nancy, could we have the spine right away?.Who's catching.There ya go.Okay We got our spine here.Spine.This is really where a partial head here.These are the bones that stack.up to make your back, you know,.within the bones itself there's a canal.and that's your spinal cord.And coming off the spinal cord are these nerves.All right these are the nerves.that can get compressed or pinched.Right.All right One of the common areas.that can get pinched is right.when it's coming outta these holes here,.the right right in that spot here,.as you get older you want to zoom in.and Brad, can you kind of point out?.Sure Yep.Okay So now the nerves remember.are not a half inch long like I'm here.They, they actually, the nerves.are go down into your arm the nerves.and this area will wrap around your chest.and the ones out here go down to your legs.But here's that whole valve talking.about where the nerve exits.from the spinal cord directly connected.to the spinal cord.As you get older there,.your neck will become arthritic.Sure.I can tell you from age 20 on it's deteriorating.these holes start to get smaller just.from arthritic changes.Right.And so there's less room.for the nerve to get out.If let's say the nerve gets a little bit.swollen suddenly there's, there's no room.for it to come out and it's getting pinched right.Where as it comes out.Sure.Less common in the lumbar area.cause these holes are quite bigger.but what can happen in the lumbar area?.Brad, bigger, the holes there are larger,.Larger.Okay The holes there are larger.Okay.And so there's a lot more room.for the nerves to come out.So it's unlikely that you're gonna get pinching.from the hole itself in the lumbar area.but you can get a disc problem.And here's a nice model.You talk about a slip disc.That's really not correct is a herniated disc.and a herniated disc, you can see here.Can you zoom in on this pretty good?.The bald dried here?.Why don't you show a healthy disc first, Brad.This is a healthy disc.Sure That's a good idea.A healthy disc is kept in here.Usually a little thicker in the front.a little narrower in the back and.It's all contained it.Exactly.Boy We know we've got another video.on some details on the disc without getting into.that the disc will actually bulge out.Put Pressure.Yeah.Put pressure on the, on a specific nerve.And that nerve will send symptoms wherever.that nerve tracks.And here they go down into the leg.And that the.the pain that you get often.from nerve pain is off quite often.Some of the worst pain you'll have.Yeah It is.Nerve pain is not fun.Exactly.I know when you can tell.when someone's drilling into a nerve.that, you know that's the way they'll.make you talk, If they wanna torture you.So the other thing that could be causing pressure.on a nerve is even scar tissue.Sure.If you a nerve, the nerve.can actually get scarred down.and when you move it,.it actually puts pressure on it.Cause increased pain.We've had sometimes I've had people that have.had scar tissue on a nerve in their back.And we actually had to stretch that nerve.Right.To break up that scar tissue.After a surgery sometimes you.can have scarred filled up or an injury.So the other thing is, as the nerves come out.anywhere along this path,.they can get ligament.And especially if you do a lot.of repetitive activities like typing.or where you're bending your wrist this way.or this way or.Factory type work.Or factory type work that ligament.can thicken up and there's less room.for the nerve to go under.And that's where you can get pinched nerve also.So the job of the physician or doctor.or physical therapist is to figure out.where along this path for your arms,.are you getting a pinch nerve or where along.you know your legs, where from the back to the legs.are you getting a pinched nerve.Right.And which we usually call sciatica.Sure.The other question: How to prevent your foot from falling asleep while you drive?
answer: The other one that is a common one that is.youre driving along.This is why you shouldnt wear your wallet.and your back pocket. Yeah. Youre gonna youre gonna actually.pressure on your CIC nerve.And I had it one time where my foot fell asleep.and I was hitting the brake.and I couldnt feel it.And Im coming to a stop light and I.I cant stop the car because Im pushing as well.All my might.So I stopped wearing my wallet in the back. Yeah
subtitles: Hi, I'm Bob Schrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck physical therapist.And together we are the most famous physical.therapists on the internet.In our opinion of course.Think fast Today we're gonna talk.about what is a pinch nerve.A lot of people get a pinch nerve.or they get a pain.And they say they've been diagnosed.and they say, well somewhere you.have a pinch nerve.We're gonna kind of go talk.about where you can pinch a nerve.and what it is and, and what,.what symptoms it gives you.Sure.So first let's talk about the symptoms.What are the things you're gonna feel when.you have a pinched nerve?.One thing you might have quite often is pain.'cause you're getting compression.on a nerve is what is is happening.And the nerves are coming out.from your spinal cord and going.from the spinal cord into your arms.and into your legs.And in this area, they wrap around the trunk.Sure They wrap around the trunk.so you can get actually pain.or a compression of a nerve anywhere.in the body in essence.Right.So let's start talking.about some of the common symptoms you're gonna feel.First off, you can have pain.you can have radiating pain, pain,.that's going down.Right?.The extremity, you can have-.Numbness, burning, tingling.A lot of times, people in the clinic.I know that when they got it in their low back.and it's going down their leg, I just.had a woman yesterday.It feels real tight, a pulling sensation.Right.It's hard to describe a nerve pain compared.to like a pain where you're, you know,.if you break your arm.or a mechanical pain is very clear.where nerve pain is also.It can be ever changing too.Yep, exactly weird.Quite often when people start getting.and that's a good way to put it.A lot of times when people come in.they're having really strange symptoms.I often go, you know what?.That sounds like nerve pain, 'cause nerve pain.It just gives you really weird things.You can get like hot and cold sensations.Sure Yeah, exactly.Pins and needles.If you start getting weakness in the arm,.that's often quite often can be-.That's getting more serious.That's getting more serious spasms.that can be from from nerve compression too.And, and one thing I wanna point out.as a therapist or a physician.or a chiropractor, we pay attention.to where that you feel the pain, you know,.is it on the front of your arm.or the back of the arm, inside of the leg.outside of the leg, because that tells us possibly.which nerve is actually being pinched.We know it's all mapped out where L three.the nerve coming out of L three and your Lumbar spine.where that goes down in your leg, you know what?.L five goes down the top of your foot.if you feel symptoms there.Right.So where you're having the pain.it could be where you're having the pinch nerve.but quite often it isn't.Right.And it's a real, it's a real treasure hunt here.Kind of trying to figure out investigative job.trying to figure out where.the problem is coming from.So let's talk about a couple, some.of the common areas where you might.have a pinch nerve.Nancy, could we have the spine right away?.Who's catching.There ya go.Okay We got our spine here.Spine.This is really where a partial head here.These are the bones that stack.up to make your back, you know,.within the bones itself there's a canal.and that's your spinal cord.And coming off the spinal cord are these nerves.All right these are the nerves.that can get compressed or pinched.Right.All right One of the common areas.that can get pinched is right.when it's coming outta these holes here,.the right right in that spot here,.as you get older you want to zoom in.and Brad, can you kind of point out?.Sure Yep.Okay So now the nerves remember.are not a half inch long like I'm here.They, they actually, the nerves.are go down into your arm the nerves.and this area will wrap around your chest.and the ones out here go down to your legs.But here's that whole valve talking.about where the nerve exits.from the spinal cord directly connected.to the spinal cord.As you get older there,.your neck will become arthritic.Sure.I can tell you from age 20 on it's deteriorating.these holes start to get smaller just.from arthritic changes.Right.And so there's less room.for the nerve to get out.If let's say the nerve gets a little bit.swollen suddenly there's, there's no room.for it to come out and it's getting pinched right.Where as it comes out.Sure.Less common in the lumbar area.cause these holes are quite bigger.but what can happen in the lumbar area?.Brad, bigger, the holes there are larger,.Larger.Okay The holes there are larger.Okay.And so there's a lot more room.for the nerves to come out.So it's unlikely that you're gonna get pinching.from the hole itself in the lumbar area.but you can get a disc problem.And here's a nice model.You talk about a slip disc.That's really not correct is a herniated disc.and a herniated disc, you can see here.Can you zoom in on this pretty good?.The bald dried here?.Why don't you show a healthy disc first, Brad.This is a healthy disc.Sure That's a good idea.A healthy disc is kept in here.Usually a little thicker in the front.a little narrower in the back and.It's all contained it.Exactly.Boy We know we've got another video.on some details on the disc without getting into.that the disc will actually bulge out.Put Pressure.Yeah.Put pressure on the, on a specific nerve.And that nerve will send symptoms wherever.that nerve tracks.And here they go down into the leg.And that the.the pain that you get often.from nerve pain is off quite often.Some of the worst pain you'll have.Yeah It is.Nerve pain is not fun.Exactly.I know when you can tell.when someone's drilling into a nerve.that, you know that's the way they'll.make you talk, If they wanna torture you.So the other thing that could be causing pressure.on a nerve is even scar tissue.Sure.If you a nerve, the nerve.can actually get scarred down.and when you move it,.it actually puts pressure on it.Cause increased pain.We've had sometimes I've had people that have.had scar tissue on a nerve in their back.And we actually had to stretch that nerve.Right.To break up that scar tissue.After a surgery sometimes you.can have scarred filled up or an injury.So the other thing is, as the nerves come out.anywhere along this path,.they can get pinched somewhere.Sure.And the common one that many of you probably.know about is carpal tunnel syndrome.and there's a band or ligament.that goes across here and the.the nerve crosses underneath that ligament.And especially if you do a lot.of repetitive activities like typing.or where you're bending your wrist this way.or this way or.Factory type work.Or factory type work that ligament.can thicken up and there's less room.for the nerve to go under.And that's where you can get pinched nerve also.So the job of the physician or doctor.or physical therapist is to figure out.where along this path for your arms,.are you getting a pinch nerve or where along.you know your legs, where from the back to the legs.are you getting a pinched nerve.Right.And which we usually call sciatica.Sure.The other thing we thought.we talked about a couple fun ones, right?.Brad, there's some names out there for.for nerves that get pinched.And these are the ones that are generally more.of a temporary pinch.but one is called Saturday night palsy.And this is apparently what happens.if you fall asleep like.on a bar or over the, over a chair like that.you get pressure on the back of your nerve, your.your arm there, that's a radial nerve palsy.and you wake up and you're so drunk.that you, you don't wake up at all.You wake up in your arms,.you can't move your arms.They're they're they're yeah.They, they, they cut off so much that the.the nerves cannot fire the muscles.It's I've never experienced that.You don't even know what that would be.But another one would be.honeymoon Phoneymoon palsy.You fall asleep and your honey's.on your arm like this.Yeah This looks like your honey.Yeah This is my honey.And all night long, you're afraid.to get away from her.And there's a joke too, about nodding off.That also causes a palsy in your arm.Another one is, could be related.as a handcuff neuropathy.I wouldn't about that either.That are too tight.they can actually put pressure on the nerves.And the last one we're gonna mention is,.is a crutch palsy.I wish we had some crutches here but.that's why when we, when you use crutches we try.to teach you that you're really not trying to.to hang on them or, or lean on to them onto them.It should not put pressure to your armpit,.Right.It should be going through your arm.You got a big plexus of nerves coming.through your armpit here and into the arm.And if you lean on those crutches.they're actually going to cause.the crutch pad is not made for padding.to put up-.The pressure should be on your.your palms.Right.And squeezing the, the crutches in.So that they're-.I got another one though Bob.I can show you this one,.Another palsy?.Yeah I don't know what you call it,.but she can't see me.Oh.If I go to sleep on my stomach.which I don't much anymore.Cause I bother with my back.But if I sleep like this.I've waken up and hours are completely.sleep completely I can't do anything.I've already done this.And I bit my hand, ah, like you.can't feel those thing.It's pretty fun.Oh, I actually, I woke up one time.and the alarm's going off in both arms like that.Yeah And I'm going like this, turn, the knock.turn the alarm off.That's kinda fun.The other one that is a common one that is.you're driving along.This is why you shouldn't wear your wallet.and your back pocket.Yeah.You're gonna -you're gonna actually.pressure on your CIC nerve.And I had it one time where my foot fell asleep.and I was hitting the brake.and I couldn't feel it.And I'm coming to a stop light and I.I can't stop the car because I'm pushing as well.All my might.So I stopped wearing my wallet in the back.Yeah.Back pocket there.That's that big thick wallet.Well, I just got papers in it.There there's nothing else in it.Believe me.All right

question: How to perform the tabletop hand exercise to strengthen the hand after an injury, stroke, cast removal, etc.?
answer: Yeah All right.Were going to start off.This is called the six pack.I went to I did my schooling at the Mayo clinic.and they used to call it the six pack there.I dont know if they invented it.or its just one that everybody uses. In Rochester Minnesota. Yes Yeah. Lets do the six pack. All right first one is six exercises.So youre going start off with what we call the tabletop.or some call it the duck.Does it look like a duck. Lets just get on with it Bob
subtitles: Bob and Brad   The two most famous   Physical therapists   On the internet  Hi folks, I'm Bob Schrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck, physical therapist.And we are the most famous physical therapists.on the internet.In our opinion, of course, Bob.I forgot to warm up Brad.Oh yeah.Okay, Brad, we're going to talk.about hand and finger exercises,.range of motion and strengthening that you can do.We're going to show you a progression,.show you some exercises you can do at home,.and then we're going to show you a set here.that was actually provided to us by FEI again.FEI.Fabrication Enterprises, Incorporated.This is their catalog If you are a therapist,.I would highly suggest that you grab one and get one.Sure.You can go to their website We'll put that link below.Right.But they gave us all this stuff.We're not getting paid for this.Right.But we don't get paid for anything, do we, Brad?.No, but we do,.we only like to represent quality or products that we like.They're good quality products,.and we feel good about giving a little bump to them.A little plug to them, yeah Mmm hmm.Okay.By the way, they provide some of these products.to retailers too and stuff.Sure.Yeah, these will probably use mostly for therapists.I don't think people are going to buy these.for an individual at home.if they had an accident or rehabbing.But then you at least you'll know what you're looking at.when you go to a therapist and they have these.Yeah, and maybe you'll buy some of these.Yeah Those for sure, actually.Yeah, I could see that.Well, we'll get to that Right.By the way, we're going to introduce.our skeleton again here.Napoleon Not Leopold.Napoleon Bone Apart.Oh yeah, Napoleon.And one of our patients thought it was fun.that she was going to go ahead and decorate it.And she's kind of creative in that regard.And it says I'm with these bone heads.So, I thought it was creative, anyway.Yeah I like what she's got down there.You can't, maybe you can't see that the knee,.she's got the the reflex hammer down there by the kneecap.Yeah And the weight tied into the hand.Yeah So, yeah.Yeah, we'll get him,.we'll get him rehabbed.Yep.All right So let's go ahead and start talking about.your hand after, maybe it was in a cast, you broke it.Sure.Maybe you have arthritis.Maybe you've had a stroke, something.It's weak It's not got the motion it should be.This is where you're going to start.Sure.Now, one of the things that you might try.if you have access to is a Parrafin Bath.This works out really well for someone who's having pain.Look at that, Brad's going to go ahead.We did a whole video on this.We won't take too much time on this right now,.but you just dip it in the Paraffin wax,.and it just envelopes the whole hand.and really provides a good source of heat.Really nice for arthritis.Really good for moisturizing the skin too.It feels great Bob did it last time.And I wanted to make sure I got in on this.[Bob] Brad wanted to get in on it, so.Yeah.[Bob] Alright While Brad's messing around with that,.why don't I go ahead and start off--.Oh, let me get the laundry done here first.Yeah Let's get that out of the way.If you are new to our channel,.I'm going to look over there.like I'm pretending someone just came in.Hi!.Please subscribe to us.We provide videos, how stay healthy, fit, pain free,.and we upload every day.Wow, wow What did you eat this morning?.I'm getting the energy level up here in the house.Holy cow.And also if you have a moment,.wander over to Facebook and like us.Please don't make us beg.We really want you to like us.Right, yeah We feel better.Yeah We feel better about ourselves whenever you do that.I feel better with my hand now This is great.So how are you going to do exercises now?.Well, just wait, Bob Let's start with this one.Yeah All right.We're going to start off.This is called the six pack.I went to, I did my schooling at the Mayo clinic,.and they used to call it the six pack there.I don't know if they invented it,.or it's just one that everybody uses.In Rochester, Minnesota.Yes Yeah.Let's do the six pack.All right, first one is six exercises.So you're going start off with what we call the tabletop.or some call it the duck.Does it look like a duck?.Let's just get on with it, Bob.All right So you go from that,.and then you can go to up to the claw, which is number two.Down, and number two.Now you can do these 10 times.Okay What's next Bob.Okay Now, this is called the P I P joint, right, Brad?.You're just going to bend that one.Ooh.So you know, these,.after an injury or a stroke or something of that nature,.these might be real difficult to do.Right.You may not be able to, you may have to--.You might only get partial way,.and then there's some more advanced things you can do.as far as, you know, holding one joint.and working on trying to get more bend to it.So next one, number four.Now this one you're going to go ahead.and just completely flex everything.and completely extend everything.Completely flex.Completely extend.Okay It's quiet in here today.Yeah, I like it.It's kind of nice.All right, the next one,.you're going to make an O with each finger.Oh, O!.Oh! (chuckles) O.Good.And then sometimes what they have you do.is slide to the bottom of this finger,.and then go back, start again.Oh Yeah.If you've got an itch on your finger,.you could itch it with your thumb like that.So.again, surprisingly Brad,.when you don't use the hand a lot in that certain fashion,.the hand actually gets tired.Yeah I can feel those muscles working.There is no doubt about it.All right, next one--.is the timer, right?.Yeah Oh yeah, it's right.Okay Next one, we're going to go ahead,.and last one, you're going to do.what we call finger abduction.So you're bringing the finger out like this.Now that my hand is warmed up from the wax, Bob,.I'm going to try it with this hand.Oh, look at that.It is amazing.Yeah.Even with a healthy hand, you could feel.how much more movable it is.Look at the erythema on there, by the way.Unfortunately, by the time this video is aired,.we are giving away one of these on Facebook,.which is another reason to like us on Facebook,.we give away a lot of stuff.But by the time this airs,.it's already going to be given away.Sorry Oh, bummer.Yeah All right.So, now that we've got the range of motion,.we're going to start doing some strengthening.And FEI has a whole bunch of strengthening things here,.there are kind of some standards here.This is the Digi-Flex.And this is the whole rack of them that they have.And it goes from the easiest one which is the tan one,.and each one of these little finger,.what would you call that?.(chuckles).See, we're not occupational therapists.They work with this more than,.by far, more than we do.Well, just this little knob here.It's like a trumpet.Well, it's for your finger.Yeah Yeah.For your finger flexors.So anyway, by pushing just the one finger,.that's just 075 pounds of pressure.Sure.If you do the whole hand, it's 25.Now moving up to like the red,.that's three pounds per finger.or 10 pounds per the hand.And if you go all the way to the most difficult one,.try even the gray one, Brad.These are very difficult.This is 13 pounds per finger, and I can't even--.Ooh Yeah, right.You know, I can't even hardly push that down.Right.And especially when you get down to the pinky.Yeah Yeah Oh my God That just--.But when you do all of them together,.it's amazing how much more, you know,.strength you can get with the cumulative--.Yeah, it pushes me to the limit though.You know, that's 43 pounds.Sure Right And so.It's got a nice contour here for the palm.So this is a set that,.it just works out really well for progression.He always puts them in upside down.Oh, did I put them in upside down?.Yeah Brad's,.Brad's more ofthat way.Yeah (chuckles).If you know what I mean?.All right, this is a Digi-Extend,.and this is just a real simple device.And what provides the resistance on here is rubber bands.I want to show some,.a lot of the different rubber bands, Brad.So, this is one of the easiest ones.And you can see, I can get all the fingers.and we're working on extending,.working on extending the fingers.And, you know, you can get more resistance.by using a heavier band.The darker the color typically,.and that's way it is on this product,.the darker the color, the more resistance.And you simply,.it takes a little time to change the rubber band out.So we're not gonna take the time to do that.And not that you have to necessarily change it.You could put two in it at the same time.Oh Sure, and double up the resistance.Yep, and the thing about that is,.yeah, now it's going to be really tough.Here, I just got it on Two of them, or one of them there.And that one is really working now.Right So.Yeah.So you can get plenty of resistance.Right.I don't care how tough you are.So the product that I really like Brad, is this Digi-Flex,.it's called, Multi-Progressive Exercise System.Yeah.This is really cool, and the reason it's really cool--.Now, again, we start with the yellow, which is only 15,.but you can interchange these.So if you're finding one of the fingers is a little bit weak.you can actually put in a heavier dose in there.So they just change easy, too.You just pull them out.I'm going to grab one of your black ones there.and slide it in, and you know, you're off and running.This is a beautiful set Right.I really love this.This is, you know, the interchangeable inserts here.And of course, again,.they're color coded by the resistance levels.And you can keep them arranged in here.So, you know,.this is something that at the professional level, you know,.occupational therapists or physical therapists.could really take advantage of for hand rehab.[Bob] To be honest, Brad, I already have,.my occupational therapist team has already been saying,."Hey, can we get at this?".And they have a patient they want to use it.Yeah, they want it.So I said, "No, we have to do the video today".And now after that, they're going to go ahead and grab it.So, all right.So, very cool.That's the, again, CanDo.This is the brand name of this, Brad, by the way.I like that Can-Do it.Yeah CanDo.Yeah Very positive.Digi-Flex Multi-Hand Exerciser.I wanted to make sure I got the name right.So, it's like a trumpet.That's what I was thinking.If you're a trumpet player and you're rehabbing,.this would be ideal (Bob laughing).It would.All right, the last one here,.you've got a little display tray here.Whoops Look at that Oh Bob.Why, Bob, why?.I didn't stick them in there hard enough.All right, this is the,.I want to, again, make sure I get it right,.the Digi-Extend and Squeeze.[Brad] Oh.[Bob] So what's nice about this.is that you're going to be able to work on flexion.and extension at the same time.Or, you know, you can work one then the other.But this is something you may want to buy.as a patient, even.[Brad] Yeah This is something I could see.Because you know,.what it has is, it's got five different firmnesses.That's what these five are.I want to push this in here to make sure.it's not going to do that same thing again.[Brad] So the darkest ball is much firmer foam rubber.Much firmer.And the lighter color yellow is much easier.Yeah, this one's a lot easier.So you'd start with the yellow.And as your hand gets stronger, progress up to the black.They also have three sizes,.and I don't know which size this is?.I don't know if this is the medium,.but they have small, medium, large.So you can figure out which one would work out.Right Depending on what size hand you have, of course.But let me just show you a few.of the exercises you can do with this.One, you can, of course, just do full flexion.You can work on just flexing the end, so the fingertips.Right Like this.So you get that pincher grip versus the full grip.And that's another one you can do, Brad,.is you can just do pincer like this.Sure Yep.You put the two fingers together.You can work pincer on each finger.Yep.You can actually work on just extension, of course.And then you can even hook in here.and work on flexion like this, you know, individually.So if you want to just work on flexion like this.Sure Yep.If you wanted to break it down that detailed.So there's a lot of different things you can do with that.So really cool set.Again, you can look at the website below.You know, right now, I'm afraid we've got to stop.and let our occupational therapists have their hand at it.(Brad chuckles).And remember, Brad and I can fix just about anything.Except for that broken heart.I don't know if this is going to help with that.But we are working on it Yeah, it might, you know.There you go.Okay Thanks

question: How to bend the fingers at the knuckles to strengthen the fingers after an injury, stroke, cast removal, etc.?
answer: Okay Whats next Bob. Okay Now this is called the P I P joint right Brad.Youre just going to bend that one. Ooh.So you know these.after an injury or a stroke or something of that nature.these might be real difficult to do. Right. You may not be able to you may have to. You might only get partial way.and then theres some more advanced things you can do.as far as you know holding one joint.and working on trying to get more bend to it
