question: How to bend all the fingers to strengthen the fingers after an injury, stroke, cast removal, etc.?
answer: and working on trying to get more bend to it.So next one number four.Now this one youre going to go ahead.and just completely flex everything.and completely extend everything.Completely flex.Completely extend.Okay Its quiet in here today. Yeah I like it. Its kind of nice
subtitles: Bob and Brad   The two most famous   Physical therapists   On the internet  Hi folks, I'm Bob Schrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck, physical therapist.And we are the most famous physical therapists.on the internet.In our opinion, of course, Bob.I forgot to warm up Brad.Oh yeah.Okay, Brad, we're going to talk.about hand and finger exercises,.range of motion and strengthening that you can do.We're going to show you a progression,.show you some exercises you can do at home,.and then we're going to show you a set here.that was actually provided to us by FEI again.FEI.Fabrication Enterprises, Incorporated.This is their catalog If you are a therapist,.I would highly suggest that you grab one and get one.Sure.You can go to their website We'll put that link below.Right.But they gave us all this stuff.We're not getting paid for this.Right.But we don't get paid for anything, do we, Brad?.No, but we do,.we only like to represent quality or products that we like.They're good quality products,.and we feel good about giving a little bump to them.A little plug to them, yeah Mmm hmm.Okay.By the way, they provide some of these products.to retailers too and stuff.Sure.Yeah, these will probably use mostly for therapists.I don't think people are going to buy these.for an individual at home.if they had an accident or rehabbing.But then you at least you'll know what you're looking at.when you go to a therapist and they have these.Yeah, and maybe you'll buy some of these.Yeah Those for sure, actually.Yeah, I could see that.Well, we'll get to that Right.By the way, we're going to introduce.our skeleton again here.Napoleon Not Leopold.Napoleon Bone Apart.Oh yeah, Napoleon.And one of our patients thought it was fun.that she was going to go ahead and decorate it.And she's kind of creative in that regard.And it says I'm with these bone heads.So, I thought it was creative, anyway.Yeah I like what she's got down there.You can't, maybe you can't see that the knee,.she's got the the reflex hammer down there by the kneecap.Yeah And the weight tied into the hand.Yeah So, yeah.Yeah, we'll get him,.we'll get him rehabbed.Yep.All right So let's go ahead and start talking about.your hand after, maybe it was in a cast, you broke it.Sure.Maybe you have arthritis.Maybe you've had a stroke, something.It's weak It's not got the motion it should be.This is where you're going to start.Sure.Now, one of the things that you might try.if you have access to is a Parrafin Bath.This works out really well for someone who's having pain.Look at that, Brad's going to go ahead.We did a whole video on this.We won't take too much time on this right now,.but you just dip it in the Paraffin wax,.and it just envelopes the whole hand.and really provides a good source of heat.Really nice for arthritis.Really good for moisturizing the skin too.It feels great Bob did it last time.And I wanted to make sure I got in on this.[Bob] Brad wanted to get in on it, so.Yeah.[Bob] Alright While Brad's messing around with that,.why don't I go ahead and start off--.Oh, let me get the laundry done here first.Yeah Let's get that out of the way.If you are new to our channel,.I'm going to look over there.like I'm pretending someone just came in.Hi!.Please subscribe to us.We provide videos, how stay healthy, fit, pain free,.and we upload every day.Wow, wow What did you eat this morning?.I'm getting the energy level up here in the house.Holy cow.And also if you have a moment,.wander over to Facebook and like us.Please don't make us beg.We really want you to like us.Right, yeah We feel better.Yeah We feel better about ourselves whenever you do that.I feel better with my hand now This is great.So how are you going to do exercises now?.Well, just wait, Bob Let's start with this one.Yeah All right.We're going to start off.This is called the six pack.I went to, I did my schooling at the Mayo clinic,.and they used to call it the six pack there.I don't know if they invented it,.or it's just one that everybody uses.In Rochester, Minnesota.Yes Yeah.Let's do the six pack.All right, first one is six exercises.So you're going start off with what we call the tabletop.or some call it the duck.Does it look like a duck?.Let's just get on with it, Bob.All right So you go from that,.and then you can go to up to the claw, which is number two.Down, and number two.Now you can do these 10 times.Okay What's next Bob.Okay Now, this is called the P I P joint, right, Brad?.You're just going to bend that one.Ooh.So you know, these,.after an injury or a stroke or something of that nature,.these might be real difficult to do.Right.You may not be able to, you may have to--.You might only get partial way,.and then there's some more advanced things you can do.as far as, you know, holding one joint.and working on trying to get more bend to it.So next one, number four.Now this one you're going to go ahead.and just completely flex everything.and completely extend everything.Completely flex.Completely extend.Okay It's quiet in here today.Yeah, I like it.It's kind of nice.All right, the next one,.you're going to make an O with each finger.Oh, O!.Oh! (chuckles) O.Good.And then sometimes what they have you do.is slide to the bottom of this finger,.and then go back, start again.Oh Yeah.If you've got an itch on your finger,.you could itch it with your thumb like that.So.again, surprisingly Brad,.when you don't use the hand a lot in that certain fashion,.the hand actually gets tired.Yeah I can feel those muscles working.There is no doubt about it.All right, next one--.is the timer, right?.Yeah Oh yeah, it's right.Okay Next one, we're going to go ahead,.and last one, you're going to do.what we call finger abduction.So you're bringing the finger out like this.Now that my hand is warmed up from the wax, Bob,.I'm going to try it with this hand.Oh, look at that.It is amazing.Yeah.Even with a healthy hand, you could feel.how much more movable it is.Look at the erythema on there, by the way.Unfortunately, by the time this video is aired,.we are giving away one of these on Facebook,.which is another reason to like us on Facebook,.we give away a lot of stuff.But by the time this airs,.it's already going to be given away.Sorry Oh, bummer.Yeah All right.So, now that we've got the range of motion,.we're going to start doing some strengthening.And FEI has a whole bunch of strengthening things here,.there are kind of some standards here.This is the Digi-Flex.And this is the whole rack of them that they have.And it goes from the easiest one which is the tan one,.and each one of these little finger,.what would you call that?.(chuckles).See, we're not occupational therapists.They work with this more than,.by far, more than we do.Well, just this little knob here.It's like a trumpet.Well, it's for your finger.Yeah Yeah.For your finger flexors.So anyway, by pushing just the one finger,.that's just 075 pounds of pressure.Sure.If you do the whole hand, it's 25.Now moving up to like the red,.that's three pounds per finger.or 10 pounds per the hand.And if you go all the way to the most difficult one,.try even the gray one, Brad.These are very difficult.This is 13 pounds per finger, and I can't even--.Ooh Yeah, right.You know, I can't even hardly push that down.Right.And especially when you get down to the pinky.Yeah Yeah Oh my God That just--.But when you do all of them together,.it's amazing how much more, you know,.strength you can get with the cumulative--.Yeah, it pushes me to the limit though.You know, that's 43 pounds.Sure Right And so.It's got a nice contour here for the palm.So this is a set that,.it just works out really well for progression.He always puts them in upside down.Oh, did I put them in upside down?.Yeah Brad's,.Brad's more ofthat way.Yeah (chuckles).If you know what I mean?.All right, this is a Digi-Extend,.and this is just a real simple device.And what provides the resistance on here is rubber bands.I want to show some,.a lot of the different rubber bands, Brad.So, this is one of the easiest ones.And you can see, I can get all the fingers.and we're working on extending,.working on extending the fingers.And, you know, you can get more resistance.by using a heavier band.The darker the color typically,.and that's way it is on this product,.the darker the color, the more resistance.And you simply,.it takes a little time to change the rubber band out.So we're not gonna take the time to do that.And not that you have to necessarily change it.You could put two in it at the same time.Oh Sure, and double up the resistance.Yep, and the thing about that is,.yeah, now it's going to be really tough.Here, I just got it on Two of them, or one of them there.And that one is really working now.Right So.Yeah.So you can get plenty of resistance.Right.I don't care how tough you are.So the product that I really like Brad, is this Digi-Flex,.it's called, Multi-Progressive Exercise System.Yeah.This is really cool, and the reason it's really cool--.Now, again, we start with the yellow, which is only 15,.but you can interchange these.So if you're finding one of the fingers is a little bit weak.you can actually put in a heavier dose in there.So they just change easy, too.You just pull them out.I'm going to grab one of your black ones there.and slide it in, and you know, you're off and running.This is a beautiful set Right.I really love this.This is, you know, the interchangeable inserts here.And of course, again,.they're color coded by the resistance levels.And you can keep them arranged in here.So, you know,.this is something that at the professional level, you know,.occupational therapists or physical therapists.could really take advantage of for hand rehab.[Bob] To be honest, Brad, I already have,.my occupational therapist team has already been saying,."Hey, can we get at this?".And they have a patient they want to use it.Yeah, they want it.So I said, "No, we have to do the video today".And now after that, they're going to go ahead and grab it.So, all right.So, very cool.That's the, again, CanDo.This is the brand name of this, Brad, by the way.I like that Can-Do it.Yeah CanDo.Yeah Very positive.Digi-Flex Multi-Hand Exerciser.I wanted to make sure I got the name right.So, it's like a trumpet.That's what I was thinking.If you're a trumpet player and you're rehabbing,.this would be ideal (Bob laughing).It would.All right, the last one here,.you've got a little display tray here.Whoops Look at that Oh Bob.Why, Bob, why?.I didn't stick them in there hard enough.All right, this is the,.I want to, again, make sure I get it right,.the Digi-Extend and Squeeze.[Brad] Oh.[Bob] So what's nice about this.is that you're going to be able to work on flexion.and extension at the same time.Or, you know, you can work one then the other.But this is something you may want to buy.as a patient, even.[Brad] Yeah This is something I could see.Because you know,.what it has is, it's got five different firmnesses.That's what these five are.I want to push this in here to make sure.it's not going to do that same thing again.[Brad] So the darkest ball is much firmer foam rubber.Much firmer.And the lighter color yellow is much easier.Yeah, this one's a lot easier.So you'd start with the yellow.And as your hand gets stronger, progress up to the black.They also have three sizes,.and I don't know which size this is?.I don't know if this is the medium,.but they have small, medium, large.So you can figure out which one would work out.Right Depending on what size hand you have, of course.But let me just show you a few.of the exercises you can do with this.One, you can, of course, just do full flexion.You can work on just flexing the end, so the fingertips.Right Like this.So you get that pincher grip versus the full grip.And that's another one you can do, Brad,.is you can just do pincer like this.Sure Yep.You put the two fingers together.You can work pincer on each finger.Yep.You can actually work on just extension, of course.And then you can even hook in here.and work on flexion like this, you know, individually.So if you want to just work on flexion like this.Sure Yep.If you wanted to break it down that detailed.So there's a lot of different things you can do with that.So really cool set.Again, you can look at the website below.You know, right now, I'm afraid we've got to stop.and let our occupational therapists have their hand at it.(Brad chuckles).And remember, Brad and I can fix just about anything.Except for that broken heart.I don't know if this is going to help with that.But we are working on it Yeah, it might, you know.There you go.Okay Thanks

question: How to touch each finger to the thumb to strengthen the fingers after an injury, stroke, cast removal, etc.?
answer: Its kind of nice.All right the next one.youre going to make an O with each finger. Oh O. Oh chuckles  O.Good.And then sometimes what they have you do.is slide to the bottom of this finger.and then go back start again. Oh  Yeah. If youve got an itch on your finger.you could itch it with your thumb like that. So.again surprisingly Brad.when you dont use the hand a lot in that certain fashion.the hand actually gets tired. Yeah I can feel those muscles working.There is no doubt about it
subtitles: Bob and Brad   The two most famous   Physical therapists   On the internet  Hi folks, I'm Bob Schrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck, physical therapist.And we are the most famous physical therapists.on the internet.In our opinion, of course, Bob.I forgot to warm up Brad.Oh yeah.Okay, Brad, we're going to talk.about hand and finger exercises,.range of motion and strengthening that you can do.We're going to show you a progression,.show you some exercises you can do at home,.and then we're going to show you a set here.that was actually provided to us by FEI again.FEI.Fabrication Enterprises, Incorporated.This is their catalog If you are a therapist,.I would highly suggest that you grab one and get one.Sure.You can go to their website We'll put that link below.Right.But they gave us all this stuff.We're not getting paid for this.Right.But we don't get paid for anything, do we, Brad?.No, but we do,.we only like to represent quality or products that we like.They're good quality products,.and we feel good about giving a little bump to them.A little plug to them, yeah Mmm hmm.Okay.By the way, they provide some of these products.to retailers too and stuff.Sure.Yeah, these will probably use mostly for therapists.I don't think people are going to buy these.for an individual at home.if they had an accident or rehabbing.But then you at least you'll know what you're looking at.when you go to a therapist and they have these.Yeah, and maybe you'll buy some of these.Yeah Those for sure, actually.Yeah, I could see that.Well, we'll get to that Right.By the way, we're going to introduce.our skeleton again here.Napoleon Not Leopold.Napoleon Bone Apart.Oh yeah, Napoleon.And one of our patients thought it was fun.that she was going to go ahead and decorate it.And she's kind of creative in that regard.And it says I'm with these bone heads.So, I thought it was creative, anyway.Yeah I like what she's got down there.You can't, maybe you can't see that the knee,.she's got the the reflex hammer down there by the kneecap.Yeah And the weight tied into the hand.Yeah So, yeah.Yeah, we'll get him,.we'll get him rehabbed.Yep.All right So let's go ahead and start talking about.your hand after, maybe it was in a cast, you broke it.Sure.Maybe you have arthritis.Maybe you've had a stroke, something.It's weak It's not got the motion it should be.This is where you're going to start.Sure.Now, one of the things that you might try.if you have access to is a Parrafin Bath.This works out really well for someone who's having pain.Look at that, Brad's going to go ahead.We did a whole video on this.We won't take too much time on this right now,.but you just dip it in the Paraffin wax,.and it just envelopes the whole hand.and really provides a good source of heat.Really nice for arthritis.Really good for moisturizing the skin too.It feels great Bob did it last time.And I wanted to make sure I got in on this.[Bob] Brad wanted to get in on it, so.Yeah.[Bob] Alright While Brad's messing around with that,.why don't I go ahead and start off--.Oh, let me get the laundry done here first.Yeah Let's get that out of the way.If you are new to our channel,.I'm going to look over there.like I'm pretending someone just came in.Hi!.Please subscribe to us.We provide videos, how stay healthy, fit, pain free,.and we upload every day.Wow, wow What did you eat this morning?.I'm getting the energy level up here in the house.Holy cow.And also if you have a moment,.wander over to Facebook and like us.Please don't make us beg.We really want you to like us.Right, yeah We feel better.Yeah We feel better about ourselves whenever you do that.I feel better with my hand now This is great.So how are you going to do exercises now?.Well, just wait, Bob Let's start with this one.Yeah All right.We're going to start off.This is called the six pack.I went to, I did my schooling at the Mayo clinic,.and they used to call it the six pack there.I don't know if they invented it,.or it's just one that everybody uses.In Rochester, Minnesota.Yes Yeah.Let's do the six pack.All right, first one is six exercises.So you're going start off with what we call the tabletop.or some call it the duck.Does it look like a duck?.Let's just get on with it, Bob.All right So you go from that,.and then you can go to up to the claw, which is number two.Down, and number two.Now you can do these 10 times.Okay What's next Bob.Okay Now, this is called the P I P joint, right, Brad?.You're just going to bend that one.Ooh.So you know, these,.after an injury or a stroke or something of that nature,.these might be real difficult to do.Right.You may not be able to, you may have to--.You might only get partial way,.and then there's some more advanced things you can do.as far as, you know, holding one joint.and working on trying to get more bend to it.So next one, number four.Now this one you're going to go ahead.and just completely flex everything.and completely extend everything.Completely flex.Completely extend.Okay It's quiet in here today.Yeah, I like it.It's kind of nice.All right, the next one,.you're going to make an O with each finger.Oh, O!.Oh! (chuckles) O.Good.And then sometimes what they have you do.is slide to the bottom of this finger,.and then go back, start again.Oh Yeah.If you've got an itch on your finger,.you could itch it with your thumb like that.So.again, surprisingly Brad,.when you don't use the hand a lot in that certain fashion,.the hand actually gets tired.Yeah I can feel those muscles working.There is no doubt about it.All right, next one--.is the timer, right?.Yeah Oh yeah, it's right.Okay Next one, we're going to go ahead,.and last one, you're going to do.what we call finger abduction.So you're bringing the finger out like this.Now that my hand is warmed up from the wax, Bob,.I'm going to try it with this hand.Oh, look at that.It is amazing.Yeah.Even with a healthy hand, you could feel.how much more movable it is.Look at the erythema on there, by the way.Unfortunately, by the time this video is aired,.we are giving away one of these on Facebook,.which is another reason to like us on Facebook,.we give away a lot of stuff.But by the time this airs,.it's already going to be given away.Sorry Oh, bummer.Yeah All right.So, now that we've got the range of motion,.we're going to start doing some strengthening.And FEI has a whole bunch of strengthening things here,.there are kind of some standards here.This is the Digi-Flex.And this is the whole rack of them that they have.And it goes from the easiest one which is the tan one,.and each one of these little finger,.what would you call that?.(chuckles).See, we're not occupational therapists.They work with this more than,.by far, more than we do.Well, just this little knob here.It's like a trumpet.Well, it's for your finger.Yeah Yeah.For your finger flexors.So anyway, by pushing just the one finger,.that's just 075 pounds of pressure.Sure.If you do the whole hand, it's 25.Now moving up to like the red,.that's three pounds per finger.or 10 pounds per the hand.And if you go all the way to the most difficult one,.try even the gray one, Brad.These are very difficult.This is 13 pounds per finger, and I can't even--.Ooh Yeah, right.You know, I can't even hardly push that down.Right.And especially when you get down to the pinky.Yeah Yeah Oh my God That just--.But when you do all of them together,.it's amazing how much more, you know,.strength you can get with the cumulative--.Yeah, it pushes me to the limit though.You know, that's 43 pounds.Sure Right And so.It's got a nice contour here for the palm.So this is a set that,.it just works out really well for progression.He always puts them in upside down.Oh, did I put them in upside down?.Yeah Brad's,.Brad's more ofthat way.Yeah (chuckles).If you know what I mean?.All right, this is a Digi-Extend,.and this is just a real simple device.And what provides the resistance on here is rubber bands.I want to show some,.a lot of the different rubber bands, Brad.So, this is one of the easiest ones.And you can see, I can get all the fingers.and we're working on extending,.working on extending the fingers.And, you know, you can get more resistance.by using a heavier band.The darker the color typically,.and that's way it is on this product,.the darker the color, the more resistance.And you simply,.it takes a little time to change the rubber band out.So we're not gonna take the time to do that.And not that you have to necessarily change it.You could put two in it at the same time.Oh Sure, and double up the resistance.Yep, and the thing about that is,.yeah, now it's going to be really tough.Here, I just got it on Two of them, or one of them there.And that one is really working now.Right So.Yeah.So you can get plenty of resistance.Right.I don't care how tough you are.So the product that I really like Brad, is this Digi-Flex,.it's called, Multi-Progressive Exercise System.Yeah.This is really cool, and the reason it's really cool--.Now, again, we start with the yellow, which is only 15,.but you can interchange these.So if you're finding one of the fingers is a little bit weak.you can actually put in a heavier dose in there.So they just change easy, too.You just pull them out.I'm going to grab one of your black ones there.and slide it in, and you know, you're off and running.This is a beautiful set Right.I really love this.This is, you know, the interchangeable inserts here.And of course, again,.they're color coded by the resistance levels.And you can keep them arranged in here.So, you know,.this is something that at the professional level, you know,.occupational therapists or physical therapists.could really take advantage of for hand rehab.[Bob] To be honest, Brad, I already have,.my occupational therapist team has already been saying,."Hey, can we get at this?".And they have a patient they want to use it.Yeah, they want it.So I said, "No, we have to do the video today".And now after that, they're going to go ahead and grab it.So, all right.So, very cool.That's the, again, CanDo.This is the brand name of this, Brad, by the way.I like that Can-Do it.Yeah CanDo.Yeah Very positive.Digi-Flex Multi-Hand Exerciser.I wanted to make sure I got the name right.So, it's like a trumpet.That's what I was thinking.If you're a trumpet player and you're rehabbing,.this would be ideal (Bob laughing).It would.All right, the last one here,.you've got a little display tray here.Whoops Look at that Oh Bob.Why, Bob, why?.I didn't stick them in there hard enough.All right, this is the,.I want to, again, make sure I get it right,.the Digi-Extend and Squeeze.[Brad] Oh.[Bob] So what's nice about this.is that you're going to be able to work on flexion.and extension at the same time.Or, you know, you can work one then the other.But this is something you may want to buy.as a patient, even.[Brad] Yeah This is something I could see.Because you know,.what it has is, it's got five different firmnesses.That's what these five are.I want to push this in here to make sure.it's not going to do that same thing again.[Brad] So the darkest ball is much firmer foam rubber.Much firmer.And the lighter color yellow is much easier.Yeah, this one's a lot easier.So you'd start with the yellow.And as your hand gets stronger, progress up to the black.They also have three sizes,.and I don't know which size this is?.I don't know if this is the medium,.but they have small, medium, large.So you can figure out which one would work out.Right Depending on what size hand you have, of course.But let me just show you a few.of the exercises you can do with this.One, you can, of course, just do full flexion.You can work on just flexing the end, so the fingertips.Right Like this.So you get that pincher grip versus the full grip.And that's another one you can do, Brad,.is you can just do pincer like this.Sure Yep.You put the two fingers together.You can work pincer on each finger.Yep.You can actually work on just extension, of course.And then you can even hook in here.and work on flexion like this, you know, individually.So if you want to just work on flexion like this.Sure Yep.If you wanted to break it down that detailed.So there's a lot of different things you can do with that.So really cool set.Again, you can look at the website below.You know, right now, I'm afraid we've got to stop.and let our occupational therapists have their hand at it.(Brad chuckles).And remember, Brad and I can fix just about anything.Except for that broken heart.I don't know if this is going to help with that.But we are working on it Yeah, it might, you know.There you go.Okay Thanks

Look at the erythema on there by the way

question: How to practice speech therapy with an iPad after suffering a stroke?
answer: okay the one.activity that I wanna work on today.is actually with our iPad ok and an application called.visual attention going to the practice mode first.okay and what its going to do is its going to give you either.symbol or a letter and what you have to do is you have to touch.each one of the indicated symbols or letters.as quickly and efficiently as you can.okay what were looking to do is youre looking to make sure you dont.miss any.but at the same time you know maintaining a pace that.is going to work for you Ok we will start with the practice.all right we will start with.similar letters and then we can always switch it up.okay so its touch.each target in order from left to right top to bottom.so essentially the same way you would read a book okay.Alright so now we have every I.and H OK.good.this actually help me find it if I miss one.that find yeah exactly.Explains to you know how many seconds it took.how many targets there were and what percentage you found on the first try.so that what is nice about this app because the records everything for you so.it takes some other work out and it gives you.you know that objective measure so we could say you know today Joe you did.eighty percent my next week you do ninety five percent you know so it gives.you that concrete evidence.Essentially what its going to do is its going to.record how long it takes you to touch the number that they say.4642.All right it gives you that nice  auditory feedback That one was.definitely a lot quicker.okay the first one was 38 the second one excuse me the first one was  eightyfive.the second one was thirtyeight.OK thats definitely  improving Give it another try okay okay.25 59.39
subtitles: we've been working on a speech therapy for.a little while now okay and I just wanted to briefly review.you know what we're doing here in speech therapy okay a lot of times.you know people might think speech therapy what do I need speech therapy for. .I speak fine but in actuality speech therapy kinda encompasses so much more than just.the act of talking so typically when.a patient is admitted on the stroke unit or the head injury unit.will evaluate a multitude of different.skill areas including swallowing disorders including speech language skills. .voice ability and also something called cognitive linguistics skills get okay so what.that incorporates is everything from.your ability to maintain attention concentration.problem-solving skills short term memory.working memory all the way down to something called deductive reasoning skills.so that the main area that we've been addressing since you've been.here.it's not that you have any swallowing trouble  no speech.issues it's more you're focusing on that short term memory.that divided attention to help you know with things like multi tasking.when you're at home or at work on and we do that as you know.with a multitude of different activities.okay the one.activity that I wanna work on today.is actually with our iPad ok and an application called.visual attention going to the practice mode first.okay and what it's going to do is its going to give you either.symbol or a letter and what you have to do is you have to touch.each one of the indicated symbols or letters.as quickly and efficiently as you can.okay what we're looking to do is you're looking to make sure you don't.miss any.but at the same time you know maintaining a pace that.is going to work for you Ok we will start with the practice.all right we will start with.similar letters and then we can always switch it up.okay so it's touch.each target in order from left to right top to bottom.so essentially the same way you would read a book okay.Alright so now we have every I.and H, OK.good.this actually help me find it if I miss one.that find yeah exactly.Explains to you know how many seconds it took.how many targets there were and what percentage you found on the first try.so that what is nice about this app because the records everything for you so.it takes some other work out and it gives you.you know that objective measure so we could say you know today Joe you did.eighty percent my next week you do ninety five percent you know so it gives.you that concrete evidence.Essentially what its going to do is its going to.record how long it takes you to touch the number that they say.46,4,2.All right it gives you that nice  auditory feedback That one was.definitely a lot quicker.okay the first one was 38 the second one, excuse me, the first one was  eighty-five.the second one was thirty-eight.OK, thats definitely  improving Give it another try okay okay.25 ,59.39.

question: How to use the Clark's sign test to identify patellofemoral pain?
answer: Just kidding. One test that we do Brad by the way.is called Clarks sign.or I think its patella grinding test. Sure. Do you wanna just roll up your pant leg Brad. Oh do I ever Bob. So lets go ahead and get this stool over here this.I would do this.He would be laying flat on the bed. Okay. But what I do is I usually tell him.to first go ahead and tighten the knee.or push the knee down into the bed.Yep like that.And I tell him to do it very slow.Okay and then I go ahead and I put my hand right here. Yep. Relax first. Okay. And then I go ahead and now tighten the knee. So now Im pulling my knee cap is gonna go.up towards my stomach. And if thats positive it is gonna be painful. Okay. All right now thats painful in some people.Is it painful on you. No but it feels a little weird. Yeah. But it I was like maybe its gonna hurt.but it really didnt. The correlation is a little questionable sometimes.but its to me its at least one of the signs
subtitles: Bob and Brad   the two most famous   physical therapists   on the internet  Hi folks.I'm Bob Shrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck, physical therapist.And we are the most famous physical therapists.on the internet.In our opinion, of course, Bob.Brad, today I wanted to talk about patellofemoral pain.and chondromalacia.Got some great self-help techniques and treatments.and exercises you can do for this problem.Techniques, having a hard time pronouncing that one.Did I say that weird?.No, no, you're doing fine.What are you smiling about?.(laughing).All right, this is Napoleon Bone Apart.Isn't that funny, Brad?.Ha ha ha.= All right, so today we're gonna show you generally.with patellofemoral pain syndrome is what they call it.You're having pain on the front part of the knee here.A lot of times around the kneecap, it often catches.It doesn't usually lock.but you might get this catching sensation.You might also get some grinding.Sure.And hear some popping even.Oftentimes going up and particularly downstairs.Yeah, very good point, Brad.Going on hilly surfaces, worse going down.The stresses on your knee are higher going down.I just saw a study on that.Yeah, I believe it.I believe it, Bob.So what you're gonna wanna do is also.what we call the movie goer sign, by the way, Brad.Oh, yes.If you're watching a movie and your knees are bent.like this, you know, for a long period of time.you start having increased pain with that.Yeah, so quit watching movies.Just kidding.One test that we do, Brad, by the way,.is called Clark's sign.or I think it's patella grinding test.Sure.Do you wanna just roll up your pant leg, Brad?.Oh, do I ever Bob.So let's go ahead and get this stool over here, this.I would do this.He would be laying flat on the bed.Okay.But what I do is I usually tell him.to first, go ahead and tighten the knee.or push the knee down into the bed.Yep, like that.And I tell him to do it very slow.Okay, and then I go ahead and I put my hand right here.Yep.Relax first.Okay.And then I go ahead and now tighten the knee.So now I'm pulling, my knee cap is gonna go.up towards my stomach.And if that's positive, it is gonna be painful.Okay.All right, now that's painful in some people.Is it painful on you?.No, but it feels a little weird.Yeah.But it I was like maybe it's gonna hurt,.but it really didn't.The correlation is a little questionable sometimes.but it's, to me, it's at least one of the signs.that you have.Sure, mm-hmm.The other signs is what.Later I'm gonna show you how to tape it.If the taping feels better,.To me, that's often a good sign.that it's patellofemoral syndrome.Right But you're gonna show that later.Yeah.Okay Bob, there's one more thing.We got some new people out there.that maybe haven't heard of our show before.Yeah, if you've never watched one of our channel-.watched our channel before,.even if you have, please take a second to subscribe.We got a subscribe button here.over here on the left hand side, left of Brad.And we provide videos on stay healthy, fit, pain free.and we upload every day.Say no more Bob, back to the knee.So what's happening with patellofemoral syndrome.or chondromalacia.is that.you got the kneecap here.and it normally.let's go on this side.I took the kneecap off on this side.You see this little canal here?.The kneecap doesn't just stay static.It actually is moving up and down.in this little canal here.Is that called the femoral groove?.Yep.Mm-hmm.So as we're going, it's moving up and along.in the femoral groove here.and what happens with patellofemoral syndrome quite often.is that it gets a little bit off track.It's not lining like it should.It's not lined up there.It's not lined up like it should.And you can see these are sharp edges here, Brad.Oh yeah.So if you, if the patella.which is a little bit soft underneath it,.as it gets over on the side here.it can actually wear out the underside of the patella.And that's the chondromalacia part of it.Sure.I mean, softening of the kneecap.Right.So what we wanna do is get it back.into the groove here and have it stay there.so it can calm down and not give you so much pain.or give you that grinding or that catching.Right You know that that's a joint actually cartilage.and you want the large surfaces rubbing against each other.as opposed to that edge Bob was talking about.Now, they used to think, Brad,.that if your knee was a little bit bent like this,.that Q angle, like on women, that that causes this.but now they finding out that's really not the case.Okay.But they are finding out.that you, if you have flat feet.that that does tend to contribute to it.So if you have flat feet.when you put weight, it changes the mechanics.so that you're more predisposed to that.Yeah It's not tracking right.Also they don't like the hip to be internally rotated.Like when you're doing sports.you don't want your leg in like this.that can predispose you to causing the knee pain.Sure.And not traveling the way it should.All right, let's talk about the first treatments.we're gonna do here, Brad.So the first thing we're gonna do.is you're just gonna go ahead and make sure you're icing.I mean, you know.Cold pack.Just get the ice pack, cold pack.after you've been doing sports.Let's try to get it to calm down.And typically you're gonna do that with a straight knee.You're not gonna have it bent, I'm assuming,.so that there's less stress on it if there at all.Well, or maybe in the loose pack position.Sure.Maybe slight flexion with,.I'd go ahead and do it in that way.The next thing I wanna do is I want you to go ahead.and start stretching that, the patella.Okay.So you're actually gonna go ahead and here's your kneecap,.and you're gonna actually, Brad,.you can do it on yours and I can do it on mine,.but you're gonna go ahead and it's gotta be relaxed.You're usually laying flat.and you're gonna go ahead and you're gonna push the patella.So here's the kneecap.I'm gonna push it down.I'm gonna push it up.And I'm also gonna push it towards the other knee.Yep.Towards the in central medial.So you gotta be relaxed to do this,.but you you see I'm pushing down.You're gonna feel it.You wanna feel the kneecap actually move.and then you're gonna also push up.Yeah, I'll see if they can get a different view this way.It's kind of hard 'cause my skid's moving all over.But you know, when I was a PT student, I had no idea.that the kneecap moved this much.Yeah.If you, if your quads are completely relaxed,.it really, you can really.move your kneecap around quite a bit.Well, and that's the problem.is some of you who have this.may not be able to move your kneecap very much.It may be very tight.These structures, you know, the quad may be tight.The patella tendon may be tight.The IT band, as it comes in here, may be all tight.Sure.The lateral structures.So that's what you're starting to do.is you're starting to do these stretches.and you can do this.I have a girl right now who's doing this.and she's in class and she's doing this while she's-.Sure.She's listening to her teacher.So you told her if you're getting bored with class.Yeah.Mobilize your kneecap.I actually you her do some straight leg raises.'cause we're gonna have her do some strengthening too.Now the probably the most standard treatment.that therapists do now for patellofemoral syndrome.is the McConnell taping.Sure.So Brad, do you wanna stay?.Yes I do.So what we're doing with this.is very simply we're gonna take the kneecap.and now I know all the therapists.that peer us out there are gonna be screaming at me here,.while the kneecap could be tilted, it could be rotated.But I have found out that with most people,.if they just try and push the kneecap over.and tape it over towards the other kneecap.Mm-hmm.And see if it feels better.Why not just try that first?.Try the simple, the simple remedy first.And this is for, for people at home.this is what all you really can do.And if it works, it works.If it doesn't work, no harm.Take it off, yeah.No harm done.Just a cost of a little bit of tape.Right.And why not give it a try?.So Brad, normally what we do is, and sometimes, you know.like if you get a McConnell taping technique.there's actually material.or that wipes they can do beforehand.Pre wipe, yep.Because the skin can get very irritated.with this taping.Sure.Some people are more predisposed.That was the other thing.This girl I had, she was keeping her tape on for a week.and a trainer had told her to do this.Sure.Oh my God, I took it off.It was red.The skin had started to break down.Yeah.So nobody can keep tape on for a week.They all really recommend 24 hours.I've seen some go 48, but.Mm-hmm.If you're allergic to it,.you're probably gonna start turning red.within a few hours.So if that happens,.get the tape off right away.And this is not an option for you.Even if you're not allergic to it,.you can build up kind of the allergy to it over, I mean.Right.A reaction to it over time.because I've seen people that I've taped for weeks.And then by the fifth week it starts getting irritated.Yeah.And usually you hope you don't have to go that long.Right.So I put an underlying underlayment tape down first.This is hypoallergenic.and I'm not really doing anything with that.Mm-hmm.But the other piece of tape, what I'm doing is-.Sometimes I'll pull that a little bit.I, I sometimes will.I usually do.Now sometimes if, if you got, you know,.someone with hairy legs,.you might wanna shave.but I'm, I'm not gonna shave my legs.Yeah, he does that on his own personal time.(laughing).So what I do here now is I usually push the kneecap over.So I'm pushing it over towards the other knee.That's usually the direction you wanna try.and I'll put the tape right on the edge of the kneecap.Sure.And I'll push it over and while I'm pushing it over.I'll pull on the tape at the same time.Yep.And you actually might get a little wrinkled.up in there in the skin and that's fine.Yep.And I usually like to do a double one, Brad.Okay.I'll sometimes make mine a little bit longer.just so it has more sticky and it has less apt to wrinkles.I agree, I agree.It should go around here.And then sometimes I'll put some tape.over the top of it to stop the edges from catching.Yeah.But again, I push over, I'm on the edge of the kneecap.I'm pushing pretty good on it, Brad.Yep.And then I pull and wrap it and the test,.you know this is a good test.A lot of times, Brad, what we'll do.Brad and I both will have somebody walk upstairs.without the tape on.And they'll say, how bad was the pain?.They'll say maybe it was a five out of 10.Sure.And then we put the tape on,.we have 'em go up and down the stairs.and we have 'em check it.And a lot of times the pain has decreased.Right, it may go down to as much as one or two.or they say, oh, that's clearly better.Then you know, you're on the right track.All right, other things you can do, if you have flat feet.you may want to get arch support.'cause that might help a bit.Sure.But let's go into some.of the strengthening exercises, Brad.One of the first ones I'm gonna have people do,.I'm gonna go, is just go ahead.and good old, straight leg raises.So you can go ahead and I'm strengthening this one here.I'm just gonna go ahead and lift up like this.and I'm go ahead and.we're getting some strengthening of the quad.Right.Lot of times on this.it's more comfortable lay down flat.Sure, you can lay down flat.But Bob's head will fall off the back of the table.The latest research is they want,.you wanna strengthen the knee extensors.Mm-hmm.The hip abductors.So I'm gonna lay on my side and I'm gonna just bend this leg.and I'm gonna work on doing these.which you can do with weight.or you can do without weight.So we're working these muscles up here.And the hip external rotators.So I'm gonna do clamshells.I'm putting my knees together like this.and I'm going like this.There you go.So why don't you turn this way?.So they can see it from both directions.You're gonna.Well it's gonna be the wrong leg.and it's gonna be by mic, but.So yeah, here's hip abductors.and here's clamshells, hip external rotators.And normally, he can't.because he's gonna go on his mic box there.but you lay down flat with a pillow and be comfortable.So the eventual thing too, Brad.is I usually try to teach people how to hop eventually.And, and that is, you know, when they're,.when they're standing, like they don't wanna hop.and land like this.Right.They wanna learn to land correctly.like this once the knee pain has gone away.Right.So the knees don't jet in towards each other.You go to the side and back,.forward and back,.keeping the knees, you know,.the knees are not going past the feet.They're, they're staying in that good athletic position.So those are some of the things to keep in mind.And when you go back to athletics, remember, you know.you're gonna start off gradually.Run on flat surfaces, not hills.Avoid the steps and all that, so.Right.Thanks for watching, folks.Good job, Bob.Thanks.Here's a nice kneecap right here Look at this

question: How to treat patellofemoral pain by pushing the knee cap?
answer: Id go ahead and do it in that way.The next thing I wanna do is I want you to go ahead.and start stretching that the patella. Okay. So youre actually gonna go ahead and heres your kneecap.and youre gonna actually Brad.you can do it on yours and I can do it on mine.but youre gonna go ahead and its gotta be relaxed.Youre usually laying flat.and youre gonna go ahead and youre gonna push the patella.So heres the kneecap.Im gonna push it down.Im gonna push it up.And Im also gonna push it towards the other knee. Yep.Towards the in central medial. So you gotta be relaxed to do this.but you you see Im pushing down.Youre gonna feel it.You wanna feel the kneecap actually move.and then youre gonna also push up. Yeah Ill see if they can get a different view this way.Its kind of hard cause my skids moving all over.But you know when I was a PT student I had no idea.that the kneecap moved this much. Yeah. If you if your quads are completely relaxed.it really you can really.move your kneecap around quite a bit. Well and thats the problem.is some of you who have this.may not be able to move your kneecap very much.It may be very tight.These structures you know the quad may be tight.The patella tendon may be tight.The IT band as it comes in here may be all tight. Sure. The lateral structures.So thats what youre starting to do.is youre starting to do these stretches.and you can do this.I have a girl right now whos doing this.and shes in class and shes doing this while shes. Sure. Shes listening to her teacher. So you told her if youre getting bored with class

Apart.Isn't that funny, Brad?.Ha ha ha.= All right, so today we're gonna show you generally.with patellofemoral pain syndrome is what they call it.You're having pain on the front part of the knee here.A lot of times around the kneecap, it often catches.It doesn't usually lock.but you might get this catching sensation.You might also get some grinding.Sure.And hear some popping even.Oftentimes going up and particularly downstairs.Yeah, very good point, Brad.Going on hilly surfaces, worse going down.The stresses on your knee are higher going down.I just saw a study on that.Yeah, I believe it.I believe it, Bob.So what you're gonna wanna do is also.what we call the movie goer sign, by the way, Brad.Oh, yes.If you're watching a movie and your knees are bent.like this, you know, for a long period of time.you start having increased pain with that.Yeah, so quit watching movies.Just kidding.One test that we do, Brad, by the way,.is called Clark's sign.or I think it's patella grinding test.Sure.Do you wanna just roll up your pant leg, Brad?.Oh, do I ever Bob.So let's go ahead and get this stool over here, this.I would do this.He would be laying flat on the bed.Okay.But what I do is I usually tell him.to first, go ahead and tighten the knee.or push the knee down into the bed.Yep, like that.And I tell him to do it very slow.Okay, and then I go ahead and I put my hand right here.Yep.Relax first.Okay.And then I go ahead and now tighten the knee.So now I'm pulling, my knee cap is gonna go.up towards my stomach.And if that's positive, it is gonna be painful.Okay.All right, now that's painful in some people.Is it painful on you?.No, but it feels a little weird.Yeah.But it I was like maybe it's gonna hurt,.but it really didn't.The correlation is a little questionable sometimes.but it's, to me, it's at least one of the signs.that you have.Sure, mm-hmm.The other signs is what.Later I'm gonna show you how to tape it.If the taping feels better,.To me, that's often a question: How to treat patellofemoral pain by taping the knee cap?
answer: Now the probably the most standard treatment.that therapists do now for patellofemoral syndrome.is the McConnell taping. Sure. So Brad do you wanna stay. Yes I do. So what were doing with this.is very simply were gonna take the kneecap.and now I know all the therapists.that peer us out there are gonna be screaming at me here.while the kneecap could be tilted it could be rotated.But I have found out that with most people.if they just try and push the kneecap over.and tape it over towards the other kneecap. Mmhmm. And see if it feels better.Why not just try that first.Try the simple the simple remedy first. And this is for for people at home.this is what all you really can do.And if it works it works.If it doesnt work no harm. Take it off yeah. No harm done. Just a cost of a little bit of tape. Right. And why not give it a try.So Brad normally what we do is and sometimes you know.like if you get a McConnell taping technique.theres actually material.or that wipes they can do beforehand. Pre wipe yep. Because the skin can get very irritated.with this taping. Sure. Some people are more predisposed.That was the other thing.This girl I had she was keeping her tape on for a week.and a trainer had told her to do this. Sure. Oh my God I took it off.It was red.The skin had started to break down. Yeah. So nobody can keep tape on for a week.They all really recommend 24 hours.Ive seen some go 48 but. Mmhmm.If youre allergic to it.youre probably gonna start turning red.within a few hours.So if that happens.get the tape off right away.And this is not an option for you.Even if youre not allergic to it.you can build up kind of the allergy to it over I mean. Right. A reaction to it over time.because Ive seen people that Ive taped for weeks.And then by the fifth week it starts getting irritated. Yeah. And usually you hope you dont have to go that long. Right. So I put an underlying underlayment tape down first.This is hypoallergenic.and Im not really doing anything with that. Mmhmm. But the other piece of tape what Im doing is. Sometimes Ill pull that a little bit. I I sometimes will.I usually do. Now sometimes if if you got you know.someone with hairy legs.you might wanna shave.but Im Im not gonna shave my legs. Yeah he does that on his own personal time.laughing.So what I do here now is I usually push the kneecap over.So Im pushing it over towards the other knee.Thats usually the direction you wanna try.and Ill put the tape right on the edge of the kneecap. Sure. And Ill push it over and while Im pushing it over.Ill pull on the tape at the same time. Yep. And you actually might get a little wrinkled.up in there in the skin and thats fine. Yep. And I usually like to do a double one Brad. Okay.Ill sometimes make mine a little bit longer.just so it has more sticky and it has less apt to wrinkles. I agree I agree.It should go around here.And then sometimes Ill put some tape.over the top of it to stop the edges from catching. Yeah. But again I push over Im on the edge of the kneecap.Im pushing pretty good on it Brad. Yep. And then I pull and wrap it and the test.you know this is a good test.A lot of times Brad what well do.Brad and I both will have somebody walk upstairs.without the tape on.And theyll say how bad was the pain.Theyll say maybe it was a five out of 10. Sure. And then we put the tape on.we have em go up and down the stairs.and we have em check it.And a lot of times the pain has decreased. Right it may go down to as much as one or two.or they say oh thats clearly better.Then you know youre on the right track
subtitles: Bob and Brad   the two most famous   physical therapists   on the internet  Hi folks.I'm Bob Shrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck, physical therapist.And we are the most famous physical therapists.on the internet.In our opinion, of course, Bob.Brad, today I wanted to talk about patellofemoral pain.and chondromalacia.Got some great self-help techniques and treatments.and exercises you can do for this problem.Techniques, having a hard time pronouncing that one.Did I say that weird?.No, no, you're doing fine.What are you smiling about?.(laughing).All right, this is Napoleon Bone Apart.Isn't that funny, Brad?.Ha ha ha.= All right, so today we're gonna show you generally.with patellofemoral pain syndrome is what they call it.You're having pain on the front part of the knee here.A lot of times around the kneecap, it often catches.It doesn't usually lock.but you might get this catching sensation.You might also get some grinding.Sure.And hear some popping even.Oftentimes going up and particularly downstairs.Yeah, very good point, Brad.Going on hilly surfaces, worse going down.The stresses on your knee are higher going down.I just saw a study on that.Yeah, I believe it.I believe it, Bob.So what you're gonna wanna do is also.what we call the movie goer sign, by the way, Brad.Oh, yes.If you're watching a movie and your knees are bent.like this, you know, for a long period of time.you start having increased pain with that.Yeah, so quit watching movies.Just kidding.One test that we do, Brad, by the way,.is called Clark's sign.or I think it's patella grinding test.Sure.Do you wanna just roll up your pant leg, Brad?.Oh, do I ever Bob.So let's go ahead and get this stool over here, this.I would do this.He would be laying flat on the bed.Okay.But what I do is I usually tell him.to first, go ahead and tighten the knee.or push the knee down into the bed.Yep, like that.And I tell him to do it very slow.Okay, and then I go ahead and I put my hand right here.Yep.Relax first.Okay.And then I go ahead and now tighten the knee.So now I'm pulling, my knee cap is gonna go.up towards my stomach.And if that's positive, it is gonna be painful.Okay.All right, now that's painful in some people.Is it painful on you?.No, but it feels a little weird.Yeah.But it I was like maybe it's gonna hurt,.but it really didn't.The correlation is a little questionable sometimes.but it's, to me, it's at least one of the signs.that you have.Sure, mm-hmm.The other signs is what.Later I'm gonna show you how to tape it.If the taping feels better,.To me, that's often a good sign.that it's patellofemoral syndrome.Right But you're gonna show that later.Yeah.Okay Bob, there's one more thing.We got some new people out there.that maybe haven't heard of our show before.Yeah, if you've never watched one of our channel-.watched our channel before,.even if you have, please take a second to subscribe.We got a subscribe button here.over here on the left hand side, left of Brad.And we provide videos on stay healthy, fit, pain free.and we upload every day.Say no more Bob, back to the knee.So what's happening with patellofemoral syndrome.or chondromalacia.is that.you got the kneecap here.and it normally.let's go on this side.I took the kneecap off on this side.You see this little canal here?.The kneecap doesn't just stay static.It actually is moving up and down.in this little canal here.Is that called the femoral groove?.Yep.Mm-hmm.So as we're going, it's moving up and along.in the femoral groove here.and what happens with patellofemoral syndrome quite often.is that it gets a little bit off track.It's not lining like it should.It's not lined up there.It's not lined up like it should.And you can see these are sharp edges here, Brad.Oh yeah.So if you, if the patella.which is a little bit soft underneath it,.as it gets over on the side here.it can actually wear out the underside of the patella.And that's the chondromalacia part of it.Sure.I mean, softening of the kneecap.Right.So what we wanna do is get it back.into the groove here and have it stay there.so it can calm down and not give you so much pain.or give you that grinding or that catching.Right You know that that's a joint actually cartilage.and you want the large surfaces rubbing against each other.as opposed to that edge Bob was talking about.Now, they used to think, Brad,.that if your knee was a little bit bent like this,.that Q angle, like on women, that that causes this.but now they finding out that's really not the case.Okay.But they are finding out.that you, if you have flat feet.that that does tend to contribute to it.So if you have flat feet.when you put weight, it changes the mechanics.so that you're more predisposed to that.Yeah It's not tracking right.Also they don't like the hip to be internally rotated.Like when you're doing sports.you don't want your leg in like this.that can predispose you to causing the knee pain.Sure.And not traveling the way it should.All right, let's talk about the first treatments.we're gonna do here, Brad.So the first thing we're gonna do.is you're just gonna go ahead and make sure you're icing.I mean, you know.Cold pack.Just get the ice pack, cold pack.after you've been doing sports.Let's try to get it to calm down.And typically you're gonna do that with a straight knee.You're not gonna have it bent, I'm assuming,.so that there's less stress on it if there at all.Well, or maybe in the loose pack position.Sure.Maybe slight flexion with,.I'd go ahead and do it in that way.The next thing I wanna do is I want you to go ahead.and start stretching that, the patella.Okay.So you're actually gonna go ahead and here's your kneecap,.and you're gonna actually, Brad,.you can do it on yours and I can do it on mine,.but you're gonna go ahead and it's gotta be relaxed.You're usually laying flat.and you're gonna go ahead and you're gonna push the patella.So here's the kneecap.I'm gonna push it down.I'm gonna push it up.And I'm also gonna push it towards the other knee.Yep.Towards the in central medial.So you gotta be relaxed to do this,.but you you see I'm pushing down.You're gonna feel it.You wanna question: How to treat patellofemoral pain by performing straight leg raises?
answer: But lets go into some.of the strengthening exercises Brad.One of the first ones Im gonna have people do.Im gonna go is just go ahead.and good old straight leg raises.So you can go ahead and Im strengthening this one here.Im just gonna go ahead and lift up like this.and Im go ahead and.were getting some strengthening of the quad. subtitles: Bob and Brad   the two most famous   physical therapists   on the internet  Hi folks.I'm Bob Shrupp, physical therapist.Brad Heineck, physical therapist.And we are the most famous physical therapists.on the internet.In our opinion, of course, Bob.Brad, today I wanted to talk about patellofemoral pain.and chondromalacia.Got some great self-help techniques and treatments.and exercises you can do for this problem.Techniques, having a hard time pronouncing that one.Did I say that weird?.No, no, you're doing fine.What are you smiling about?.(laughing).All right, this is Napoleon Bone Apart.Isn't that funny, Brad?.Ha ha ha.= All right, so today we're gonna show you generally.with patellofemoral pain syndrome is what they call it.You're having pain on the front part of the knee here.A lot of times around the kneecap, it often catches.It doesn't usually lock.but you might get this catching sensation.You might also get some grinding.Sure.And hear some popping even.Oftentimes going up and particularly downstairs.Yeah, very good point, Brad.Going on hilly surfaces, worse going down.The stresses on your knee are higher going down.I just saw a study on that.Yeah, I believe it.I believe it, Bob.So what you're gonna wanna do is also.what we call the movie goer sign, by the way, Brad.Oh, yes.If you're watching a movie and your knees are bent.like this, you know, for a long period of time.you start having increased pain with that.Yeah, so quit watching movies.Just kidding.One test that we do, Brad, by the way,.is called Clark's sign.or I think it's patella grinding test.Sure.Do you wanna just roll up your pant leg, Brad?.Oh, do I ever Bob.So let's go ahead and get this stool over here, this.I would do this.He would be laying flat on the bed.Okay.But what I do is I usually tell him.to first, go ahead and tighten the knee.or push the knee down into the bed.Yep, like that.And I tell him to do it very slow.Okay, and then I go ahead and I put my hand right here.Yep.Relax first.Okay.And then I go ahead and now tighten the knee.So now I'm pulling, my knee cap is gonna go.up towards my stomach.And if that's positive, it is gonna be painful.Okay.All right, now that's painful in some people.Is it painful on you?.No, but it feels a little weird.Yeah.But it I was like maybe it's gonna hurt,.but it really didn't.The correlation is a little questionable sometimes.but it's, to me, it's at least one of the signs.that you have.Sure, mm-hmm.The other signs is what.Later I'm gonna show you how to tape it.If the taping feels better,.To me, that's often a good sign.that it's patellofemoral syndrome.Right But you're gonna show that later.Yeah.Okay Bob, there's one more thing.We got some new people out there.that maybe haven't heard of our show before.Yeah, if you've never watched one of our channel-.watched our channel before,.even if you have, please take a second to subscribe.We got a subscribe button here.over here on the left hand side, left of Brad.And we provide videos on stay healthy, fit, pain free.and we upload every day.Say no more Bob, back to the knee.So what's happening with patellofemoral syndrome.or chondromalacia.is that.you got the kneecap here.and it normally.let's go on this side.I took the kneecap off on this side.You see this little canal here?.The kneecap doesn't just stay static.It actually is moving up and down.in this little canal here.Is that called the femoral groove?.Yep.Mm-hmm.So as we're going, it's moving up and along.in the femoral groove here.and what happens with patellofemoral syndrome quite often.is that it gets a little bit off track.It's not lining like it should.It's not lined up there.It's not lined up like it should.And you can see these are sharp edges here, Brad.Oh yeah.So if you, if the patella.which is a little bit soft underneath it,.as it gets over on the side here.it can actually wear out the underside of the patella.And that's the chondromalacia part of it.Sure.I mean, softening of the kneecap.Right.So what we wanna do is get it back.into the groove here and have it stay there.so it can calm down and not give you so much pain.or give you that grinding or that catching.Right You know that that's a joint actually cartilage.and you want the large surfaces rubbing against each other.as opposed to that edge Bob was talking about.Now, they used to think, Brad,.that if your knee was a little bit bent like this,.that Q angle, like on women, that that causes this.but now they finding out that's really not the case.Okay.But they are finding out.that you, if you have flat feet.that that does tend to contribute to it.So if you have flat feet.when you put weight, it changes the mechanics.so that you're more predisposed to that.Yeah It's not tracking right.Also they don't like the hip to be internally rotated.Like when you're doing sports.you don't want your leg in like this.that can predispose you to causing the knee pain.Sure.And not traveling the way it should.All right, let's talk about the first treatments.we're gonna do here, Brad.So the first thing we're gonna do.is you're just gonna go ahead and make sure you're icing.I mean, you know.Cold pack.Just get the ice pack, cold pack.after you've been doing sports.Let's try to get it to calm down.And typically you're gonna do that with a straight knee.You're not gonna have it bent, I'm assuming,.so that there's less stress on it if there at all.Well, or maybe in the loose pack position.Sure.Maybe slight flexion with,.I'd go ahead and do it in that way.The next thing I wanna do is I want you to go ahead.and start stretching that, the patella.Okay.So you're actually gonna go ahead and here's your kneecap,.and you're gonna actually, Brad,.you can do it on yours and I can do it on mine,.but you're gonna go ahead and it's gotta be relaxed.You're usually laying flat.and you're gonna go ahead and you're gonna push the patella.So here's the kneecap.I'm gonna push it down.I'm gonna push it up.And I'm also gonna push it towards the other knee.Yep.Towards the in central medial.So you gotta be relaxed to do this,.but you you see I'm pushing down.You're gonna feel it.You wanna feel the kneecap actually move.and then you're gonna also push up.Yeah, I'll see if they can get a different view this way.It's kind of hard 'cause my skid's moving all over.But you know, when I was a PT student, I had no idea.that the kneecap moved this much.Yeah.If you, if your quads are completely relaxed,.it really, you can really.move your kneecap around quite a bit.Well, and that's the problem.is some of you who have this.may not be able to move your kneecap very much.It may be very tight.These structures, you know, the quad may be tight.The patella tendon may be tight.The IT band, as it comes in here, may be all tight.Sure.The lateral structures.So that's what you're starting to do.is you're starting to do these stretches.and you can do this.I have a girl right now who's doing this.and she's in class and she's doing this while she's-.Sure.She's listening to her teacher.So you told her if you're getting bored with class.Yeah.Mobilize your kneecap.I actually you her do some straight leg raises.'cause we're gonna have her do some strengthening too.Now the probably the most standard treatment.that therapists do now for patellofemoral syndrome.is the McConnell taping.Sure.So Brad, do you wanna stay?.Yes I do.So what we're doing with this.is very simply we're gonna take the kneecap.and now I know all the therapists.that peer us out there are gonna be screaming at me here,.while the kneecap could be tilted, it could be rotated.But I have found out that with most people,.if they just try and push the kneecap over.and tape it over towards the other kneecap.Mm-hmm.And see if it feels better.Why not just try that first?.Try the simple, the simple remedy first.And this is for, for people at home.this is what all you really can do.And if it works, it works.If it doesn't work, no harm.Take it off, yeah.No harm done.Just a cost of a little bit of tape.Right.And why not give it a try?.So Brad, normally what we do is, and sometimes, you know.like if you get a McConnell taping technique.there's actually material.or that wipes they can do beforehand.Pre wipe, yep.Because the skin can get very irritated.with this taping.Sure.Some people are more predisposed.That was the other thing.This girl I had, she was keeping her tape on for a week.and a trainer had told her to do this.Sure.Oh my God, I took it off.It was red.The skin had started to break down.Yeah.So nobody can keep tape on for a week.They all really recommend 24 hours.I've seen some go 48, but.Mm-hmm.If you're allergic to it,.you're probably gonna start turning red.within a few hours.So if that happens,.get the tape off right away.And this is not an option for you.Even if you're not allergic to it,.you can build up kind of the allergy to it over, I mean.Right.A reaction to it over time.because I've seen people that I've taped for weeks.And then by the fifth week it starts getting irritated.Yeah.And usually you hope you don't have to go that long.Right.So I put an underlying underlayment tape down first.This is hypoallergenic.and I'm not really doing anything with that.Mm-hmm.But the other piece of tape, what I'm doing is-.Sometimes I'll pull that a little bit.I, I sometimes will.I usually do.Now sometimes if, if you got, you know,.someone with hairy legs,.you might wanna shave.but I'm, I'm not gonna shave my legs.Yeah, he does that on his own personal time.(laughing).So what I do here now is I usually push the kneecap over.So I'm pushing it over towards the other knee.That's usually the direction you wanna try.and I'll put the tape right on the fine.Yep.And I usually like to do a double one, Brad.Okay.I'll sometimes make mine a little bit longer.just so it has more sticky and it has less apt to wrinkles.I agree, I agree.It should go around here.And then sometimes I'll put some tape.over the top of it to stop the edges from catching.Yeah.But again, I push over, I'm on the edge of the kneecap.I'm pushing pretty good on it, Brad.Yep.And then I pull and wrap it and the test,.you know this is a good test.A lot of times, Brad, what we'll do.Brad and I both will have somebody walk upstairs.without the tape on.And they'll say, how bad was the pain?.They'll say maybe it was a five out of 10.Sure.And then we put the tape on,.we have 'em go up and down the stairs.and we have 'em check it.And a lot of times the pain has decreased.Right, it may go down to as much as one or two.or they say, oh, that's clearly better.Then you know, you're on the right track.All right, other things you can do, if you have flat feet.you may want to get arch support.'cause that might help a bit.Sure.But let's go into some.of the strengthening exercises, Brad.One of the first ones I'm gonna have people do,.I'm gonna go, is just go ahead.and good old, straight leg raises.So you can go ahead and I'm strengthening this one here.I'm just gonna go ahead and lift up like this.and I'm go ahead and.we're getting some strengthening of the quad.Right.Lot of times on this.it's more comfortable lay down flat.Sure, you can lay down flat.But Bob's head will fall off the back of the table.The latest research is they want,.you wanna strengthen the knee extensors.Mm-hmm.The hip abductors.So I'm gonna lay on my side and I'm gonna just bend this leg.and I'm gonna work on doing these.which you can do with weight.or you can do without weight.So we're working these muscles up here.And the hip external rotators.So I'm gonna do clamshells.I'm putting my knees together like this.and I'm going like this.There you go.So why don't you turn this way?.So normally, he can't.because he's gonna go on his mic box there.but you lay down flat with a pillow and be comfortable.So the eventual thing too, Brad.is I usually try to teach people how to hop
